Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir bacon and onion until bacon is evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Transfer bacon and onion to a large bowl. Stir in eggs, potatoes, Cheddar cheese, cottage cheese, and Swiss cheese.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Pour mixture into the prepared baking dish.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set and cheese is melted, 45 to 50 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting and serving.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Sausage Casserole
Ingredients: 3 cups shredded potatoes, drained and pressed
1 (16 ounce) container small curd cottage cheese
Directions:
Step 1: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
ALLRECIPES / KAREN HIBBARD

Step 2: Heat a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Cook sausage in the hot skillet until evenly browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.
ALLRECIPES / KAREN HIBBARD

Step 3: Stir together shredded potatoes and butter in the prepared baking dish; lightly press mixture into the bottom and sides of the dish.
ALLRECIPES / KAREN HIBBARD

Step 4: Mix together sausage, cottage cheese, Cheddar cheese, onion, and eggs in a bowl. Pour over potato mixture.
ALLRECIPES / KAREN HIBBARD

Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of casserole comes out clean, about 1 hour. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
ALLRECIPES / KAREN HIBBARD

Step 6: Enjoy!
ALLRECIPES / KAREN HIBBARD

Name: Breakfast Strata
Ingredients: 1 ½ cups cubed Black Forest ham
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
Directions: Step 1: Generously grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
Step 2: Heat a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir sausage until crumbly and completely browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer cooked sausage to the prepared casserole dish.
Step 3: Cook and stir mushrooms in the same skillet over medium heat until liquid has been released and mushrooms are lightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes; drain.

Step 4: Combine mushrooms, bread, eggs, milk, Cheddar cheese, ham, spinach, flour, dry mustard, butter, basil, and salt together in a large bowl; pour over sausage. Cover casserole dish and refrigerate, 2 hours to overnight.
Step 5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 60 to 70 minutes.

Name: Fluffy Egg Strata
Ingredients: 12 thick slices white bread, cut into 1 inch cubes
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 2: Toss cubed bread, cheese, mushrooms, and bacon together in a large bowl; pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 3: Whisk eggs, half-and-half, and mustard together until smooth; pour evenly over bread mixture.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 4: You can bake the strata straightaway but for better results, cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 5: Remove plastic wrap from the baking dish; bake strata in the preheated oven until eggs are set and top is golden brown, about 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Name: Bacon, Cheddar and Spinach Strata
Ingredients: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 pound sliced bacon, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch strips
1 pound fresh spinach, wilted, squeezed dry
12 ounces shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese, divided
Directions: Step 1: Oil bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish with about a tablespoon of bacon fat.
Step 2: Place bread cubes in a large mixing bowl.
Step 3: Crack eggs into a separate mixing bowl. Season with salt, pepper, cayenne, and nutmeg. Add cream and whisk mixture thoroughly.
Step 4: Pour egg/cream mixture over the bread cubes and mix to distribute ingredients evenly. Allow bread mixture to sit about 15 minutes to absorb the liquid.

Step 5: Transfer half of the bread mixture to the baking pan; spread evenly over the bottom and press mixture down a bit. Top with half of the grated Cheddar cheese. Add cooked bacon pieces in an even layer over the cheese. Place the cooked spinach over the bacon; top with half of the remaining cheese. Finish with the rest of the soaked bread cubes, spread evenly and pressed down slightly. Sprinkle with the rest of the grated cheese. Cover and let strata sit at room temperature for 1 hour before baking.
Step 6: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 7: Bake strata in preheated oven until set, about 45 minutes. Optionally, you can broil the strata for a minute or two to brown the top.
CHEF JOHN

Name: Turkey Brine
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
WILL DICKEY / FOOD STYLING: MARGARET DICKEY / PROP STYLING: PHOEBE HAUSER

Step 2: Combine vegetable broth, sea salt, rosemary, sage, thyme, and savory in a large stockpot. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently to be sure salt is dissolved. Remove from heat, and let cool to room temperature. When broth mixture is cool, pour it into a clean food-grade 5-gallon bucket. Stir in the ice water.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Rinse and dry your turkey. Make sure you have removed the innards. Place turkey, breast-side down, into the brine. Make sure that the cavity gets filled. Place the bucket in the refrigerator for 8 hours, or overnight.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Remove turkey carefully, draining off excess brine and pat dry. Discard excess brine. Cook turkey as desired reserving the drippings for gravy. Keep in mind that brined turkeys cook 20 to 30 minutes faster so watch the temperature gauge.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Simple Chicken Brine
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Pour warm water into a container that is twice the volume of the water.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add salt, soy sauce, sugar, and olive oil; stir until sugar and salt have dissolved.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Allow brine to cool to room temperature.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Simple Turkey Brine
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS
Step 2: Bring water to a boil in a large stockpot.

Step 3: Stir in salt and brown sugar until dissolved; return to a boil.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS

Step 4: Add bay leaves, peppercorns, rosemary, thyme, and cloves. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS

Step 5: Remove from the heat and let cool completely before using.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS

Step 6: Place thawed turkey into a large non-reactive container. Pour in cooled brine.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS

Step 7: Pour in enough cool water to cover turkey with liquid. Refrigerate 8 to 12 hours.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS

Step 8: Remove turkey from brine and let sit on counter for about 2 hours.
ALLRECIPES/OANA ENNIS
Step 9: Follow your favorite recipe to cook your turkey.

Name: Warm Broccoli Caesar Salad
Ingredients: 1 1/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, divided
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE
Step 2: Spread out broccoli on a large rimmed baking sheet. Toss with 2 tablespoons of the canola oil, 3/4 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper until evenly coated.

Step 3: Roast in the preheated oven until broccoli is bright green and browned in spots, 18 to 20 minutes.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 4: Meanwhile, combine 1/2 cup oil, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, eggs, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, Dijon mustard, 3/4 teaspoon black pepper, and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a blender; process until smooth, about 2 minutes. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 5: Add bacon to a large skillet over medium heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until crispy, about 10 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon fat in skillet and do not wipe clean; discard remaining drippings.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 6: Add panko and remaining 1/4 teaspoon black pepper to skillet over low heat; cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 7: Transfer broccoli to a large serving bowl. Top with panko, bacon, and remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan. Drizzle with desired amount of Caesar dressing. Refrigerate remaining Caesar dressing for up to 4 days.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Name: Broccoli Crunch Salad
Ingredients: 4 cups broccoli florets, broken into bite-sized pieces
Directions: Step 1: Combine mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, sugar, onion powder, pepper, and salt in a bowl. Whisk together until smooth and creamy. Set aside.
Step 2: In a large bowl combine broccoli slaw, broccoli florets, red onion, sunflower seeds, dried cranberries, and bacon. Pour dressing mix on top of broccoli mix and toss until well coated.

Step 3: Chill until ready to serve.
From the Editor:
Need tips for cooking a small amount of bacon? Here's a quick way to cook bacon in the microwave.

Name: Broccoli Caesar Salad
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Step 2: For croutons, toss bread and butter on a 10x15-inch rimmed baking sheet; spread in an even layer. Bake, stirring halfway through, until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Step 3: Meanwhile, stir together broccoli, dressing, Parmesan, and lemon juice in a large bowl. Add croutons and pepper; toss to coat. Serve with lemon wedges and garnish with additional Parmesan.

Name: Tiramisu Blondies
Ingredients: 1/2 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
1 tablespoon Dutch-processed cocoa powder, or as needed
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line an 8x8-inch square pan with enough parchment paper to have overhang on all sides.

Step 2: In a large bowl, whisk together melted butter, brown sugar, white sugar, espresso powder, and salt until thoroughly combined. Add in egg, 2 teaspoons vanilla, and coffee liqueur and whisk until mixture is combined and lightens in color slightly, about 1 minute. Whisk in flour and baking soda until just combined. Pour batter into the prepared pan and spread into an even layer.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until the bars begin to slightly pull away from the edges of the pan, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven and allow bars to cool completely in the pan.

Step 4: For frosting, beat butter in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Add confectioner’s sugar, vanilla, and salt and beat until completely smooth and incorporated. Add heavy cream; beat for another 2 minutes. Add mascarpone, and mix on low speed until just combined.

Step 5: Spread frosting evenly over the cooled bars. Sprinkle cocoa powder evenly over the top of frosting. Refrigerate bars to firm up frosting, about 30 minutes. Remove bars from pan, cut into 16 bars, and serve.

Name: The Best Gluten Free Brownies Ever...Seriously
Ingredients: ½ cup chopped walnuts, or to taste (Optional)
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 2: Toss walnuts and chocolate chips with 1 teaspoon cocoa powder in a bowl until well coated; set aside. Mix tapioca flour, sorghum flour, teff flour, 1/3 cup cocoa powder, xanthan gum, and salt together in a separate bowl.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 3: Beat butter and sugar together in a separate large bowl until creamy and lighter in color. Stir in eggs and vanilla extract.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 4: Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture until fully incorporated. Fold in nuts and chocolate chips.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 5: Spread batter into the prepared baking pan.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until the top is dry and the edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 25 minutes.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Name: Deviled Blondies
Ingredients: 1 rounded tablespoon Gochujang chili paste, or chili paste of your choice
2 sticks salted butter, melted and cooled slightly
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9 cake pan and line the bottom with parchment paper.
Step 2: For the sweet and spicy chili topping, combine butter, brown sugar, and Gochujang in a small bowl, and mix thoroughly into a smooth paste. Set aside at room temperature until needed.
Step 3: For the blondie batter, combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl; mix thoroughly to combine. Set aside.

Step 4: Combine white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract in a second bowl. Using an electric mixer beat until smooth and thick. Pour in melted butter, and beat until batter is smooth. Fold in macadamia nuts and flour mixture using a spatula, carefully stirring and folding just until the flour disappears. Transfer batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth out the top.

Step 5: Transfer chili mixture on top in 12 evenly spaced dollops. Use the tip of a knife to make a flame design out of each dollop by running the knife in a few different dirctions. Make sure to push some of the chili mixture down into the batter as well. When done, the surface should have about a 50/50 ratio between red and blond streaks. Tap pan on the counter a few times.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.

Step 7: Transfer to a wire rack and cool completely before removing brownies from pan. Cut into 9 brownies. For best results, serve chilled.
CHEF JOHN

Name: Bruschetta with Shallots
Ingredients: freshly ground black pepper to taste
⅓ cup extra virgin olive oil
¼ cup extra virgin olive oil
1 (1 pound) loaf Italian bread, cut into 1/2 inch slices
Directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, toss together the roma tomatoes, minced garlic, shallots, basil, lemon juice, salt, pepper and 1/3 cup olive oil.
Step 2: Place the slivered garlic and 1/4 cup olive oil in small saucepan over medium heat. Slowly cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes. Discard garlic.
Step 3: Toast the bread slices, and brush with the olive oil heated with garlic. Top slices with the roma tomato mixture.

Name: Tomato and Ricotta Salata Bruschetta
Ingredients: 1 loaf Italian bread, cut into 1/2-inch diagonal slices
6 medium tomatoes, seeded and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1 (4 ounce) package ricotta salata, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place bread slices on a baking sheet.
Step 2: Bake in the preheated oven until toasted, about 5 minutes. Rub 1 side of the bread with the cut garlic.
Step 3: Toss tomatoes, ricotta salata, olive oil, vinegar, onion, basil, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Divide evenly over bread.

Name: Bruschette al Lardo di Colonnata
Ingredients: 1 loaf crusty Italian bread, sliced and toasted
7 ounces lardo (such as Lardo di Colonnata)
freshly ground pink peppercorns to taste
Directions: Step 1: Mince 1 of the garlic halves and transfer to a bowl. Add tomatoes, rosemary, olive oil, red pepper flakes, and salt; mix well. Refrigerate tomato mixture for 1 hour.
Step 2: Rub the remaining garlic half over each slice of bread. Spread lardo onto each slice and top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle ground pink peppercorns over tomato mixture.

Name: Buffalo Chicken Dip
Ingredients: ¾ cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot)
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Heat chicken and hot pepper sauce in a skillet over medium heat until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in cream cheese and ranch dressing. Cook and stir until well blended and warm, 3 to 5 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Mix in 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese, and transfer the mixture to a slow cooker. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over top.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Cover and cook on Low until dip is hot and bubbly, about 35 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Serve with celery sticks and crackers.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Chicken Wing Dip
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Mix cream cheese and hot pepper sauce together in a medium bowl until well blended; stir in chicken, dressing, and Cheddar cheese.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Spread into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 30 minutes. If oil collects on the top, dab it off using a paper towel.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Serve and enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Cheesy Buffalo Chicken Dip
Ingredients: ⅓ cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot)
Directions: Step 1: Place chicken breasts in a large saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a breast should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Drain and allow chicken to cool enough to handle. Pull meat from bones and skin. Shred meat and set aside.
Step 2: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir celery in hot oil until soft. Mix in cream cheese, blue cheese dressing, and ranch dressing. Cook and stir until smooth and creamy. Stir in shredded chicken and hot sauce. Transfer to an 8x8-inch baking dish and sprinkle with shredded cheese.

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until golden and bubbly, about 30 minutes.
ALLRECIPESPHOTO

Name: Boneless Buffalo Wings
Ingredients: 3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1/2-inch strips
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients and heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Combine flour, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, and garlic powder in a large bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Whisk egg and milk together in a small bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Dip each piece of chicken in egg mixture, then roll in flour mixture. Repeat so that each piece of chicken is double-coated. Refrigerate breaded chicken for 20 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Fry chicken in hot oil in batches. Cook until golden brown and juices run clear, 5 to 6 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Combine hot sauce and butter in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat sauce in the microwave until melted, 20 to 30 seconds. Pour sauce over fried chicken; mix to coat.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Serve and enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Air Fryer Buffalo Wings
Ingredients: ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Directions: Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 380 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Step 2: Combine sea salt, garlic powder, mustard powder, coriander, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, and black pepper in a shallow bowl. Dredge each chicken wing in the spice mixture and set into the air fryer basket in one layer.

Step 3: Cook in the air fryer until chicken wings are no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). If wings are smaller, reduce cooking time.

Name: Grilled Buffalo Wings
Ingredients: 3 pounds chicken wings, separated at joints, tips discarded
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle cola-flavored carbonated beverage
¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat a grill to medium heat.
Step 2: Mix hot sauce, cola, cayenne pepper, black pepper and soy sauce together in a large pot; add wings to the sauce. Place the pot on one side of the preheated grill; bring to a simmer.

Step 3: Use tongs to transfer wings out of sauce and place on the preheated grill; cook until lightly charred on both sides, about 8 to 10 minutes, then return wings to the sauce to continue cooking. Repeat this process until chicken is cooked and pulls easily off of the bone, and the sauce is hot and thickened, about 50 minutes. You can serve them as sloppy-style wings, or serve right off the grill for dryer wings.

Name: Tri-Tip Bulgogi
Ingredients: 1 thumb-sized piece fresh ginger, cut into chunks
3 tablespoons gochujang ( Korean hot pepper paste )
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 (8 ounce) package cooked microwave basmati rice
Directions: Step 1: Combine pear, onion, ginger, 1/2 cup soy sauce, and 2 garlic cloves in the jar of a blender or food processor and pulse until marinade is smooth. Place tri-tip into a resealable plastic bag with the marinade. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to overnight.
Step 2: Slice tri-tip thinly against the grain.
Step 3: Add grapeseed oil to a skillet over medium-high heat. When skillet is hot, sear meat until nice and charred, about 1 minute on each side. Remove meat from pan.

Step 4: Add gochujang, rice vinegar, soy sauce, white sugar, minced garlic, minced ginger, and 1/2 cup water to the skillet. Stir until blended and smooth. Simmer sauce for 3 minutes and return meat back to the pan; simmer meat in sauce until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Step 5: Remove bulgogi from heat, drizzle with sesame oil, and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Heat rice in the microwave for 90 seconds, or according to package directions.
Step 6: Plate bulgogi with rice, kimchi, and steamed veggies. Garnish with sliced scallions.

Name: Beef Bulgogi
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Whisk soy sauce, green onion, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, and pepper together in a bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Place flank steak slices in a shallow dish. Pour marinade over top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.

Step 5: Quickly grill flank steak slices on the preheated grill until slightly charred and cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Serve hot and enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Easy Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Beef)
Ingredients: 2 green onions, chopped, dark green parts separated from white and light green parts
¼ teaspoon Korean red pepper flakes
1 ½ pounds beef sirloin steak, cut very thin using kitchen shears
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Whisk soy sauce, white and light green parts of green onions, yellow onion, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, ginger, and black pepper together in a large glass or ceramic bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add steak slices and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour, or up to 1 day.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Heat a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, cook and stir steak and marinade together in the hot skillet, adding honey to caramelize the steak, until steak is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Garnish bulgogi with dark green parts of green onions.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: The Crustburger
Ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 slice American cheese, such as Kraft  Deluxe® American cheese slices
1/2 teaspoon hot sauce, such as Crystal® hot sauce
Directions: Step 1: Heat a heavy skillet or griddle over medium heat. Spread butter over top of bun and bottom of bottom bun and place in skillet. Press down firmly with a spatula to completely flatten buns. Cook until toasted on both sides and set aside.

Step 2: Increase the heat under the skillet to medium-high. Place meat in a mounded ball into the hot skillet and press firmly to flatten with a spatula. Gently work the spatula in a circular motion to form a very thin patty with jagged edges. Season with salt and pepper.

Step 3: Place onion on top and cook until browned around the edges. Top with cheese and cook until  cheese melts. Scrape burger from the skillet and place on top of the bun top. Invert the other bun so that the inside of the bun is now the outside. Place burger back in skillet and cook about 1 minute on each side.

Step 4: Stir mayonnaise, ketchup, hot sauce, and fish sauce together in a small bowl. Serve sauce alongside the burger.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Copycat McChicken Sandwich
Ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces
3/4 pound boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
oil for frying, or as needed
Directions: Step 1: Combine chicken, garlic powder, white pepper, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, and 1 teaspoon salt in a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped and it forms a uniform mixture.
Step 2: Shape chicken mixture into 6 patties and freeze on a parchment or wax paper-lined baking sheet for 20 to 30 minutes.

Step 3: Heat oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Whisk together flour, cornstarch, remaining salt, remaining paprika, and pepper in a bowl. Lightly coat partially frozen patties in flour mixture and shake off any excess mixture and set patties aside.
Step 4: Add club soda to remaining flour mixture in bowl and whisk to combine.

Step 5: Working 2 to 3 at a time, dip patties into batter, allow excess to drip off and carefully place into the hot oil. Fry, while maintaining a temperature of 330 to 350 degrees F (165 to 175 degrees C), until golden brown, crispy, and cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes per batch. Drain on a wire rack set inside a paper towel lined rimmed baking sheet.  Repeat with remaining patties.

Step 6: Serve patties on buns with shredded lettuce and mayonnaise. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH VIDEO STUDIOS
From the Editor
We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. Amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used.
Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of flour. The actual amount of flour consumed will vary.

Name: Southwestern Breakfast Burrito
Directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs with the cream, salsa, cumin and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Step 2: In a non stick skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter and then scramble the eggs. Just before they are set, add the cheese and fold-in until it begins to melt.

Step 3: Lay the tortillas on a flat surface. Divide the eggs equally between the two and place on the bottom third of each tortilla. Fold the bottom third over tucking in. Fold in the two sides and then roll up. Serve.

Name: Fabulous Wet Burritos
Ingredients: 1 (4.5 ounce) can diced green chile peppers
2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided
½ cup chopped green onions, divided
Directions: Step 1: Crumble ground beef into a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until evenly browned. Add onion and cook until translucent. Drain grease, and season with garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper. Stir in refried beans and green chilies until well blended. Turn off heat but keep warm.
Step 2: Combine canned chili, condensed soup, and enchilada sauce in a saucepan. Mix well and cook over medium heat until heated through. Turn off the heat and keep warm.

Step 3: Place warmed tortilla on a plate and spoon a generous 1/2 cup of the ground beef mixture onto the center. Top with a portion of lettuce and tomato to your liking. Roll up tortilla around the filling, while tucking in the sides. Spoon a generous amount of the sauce over the top and sprinkle with a portion of cheese and green onions. Heat in the microwave until cheese is melted, about 30 seconds. Repeat with remaining tortillas and fillings.
DIXIEBROCK47

Name: Delicious Black Bean Burritos
Ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Wrap tortillas in foil.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 2: Bake wrapped tortillas in the preheated oven until heated through, about 15 minutes.

Step 3: Meanwhile, heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and jalapeño; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Stir in beans and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. Stir in cream cheese and salt; cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Stir in cilantro.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Spoon filling in a line across the middle of each tortilla. Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling. Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling creating a burrito. Serve immediately.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Harissa Butternut Squash Soup
Ingredients: 1 butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cubed (about 4 cups)
4 cups chicken broth or vegetable broth
2/3 cup heavy cream, or as needed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss butternut squash, onion, and whole garlic with olive oil. Spread out on the prepared baking sheet.
Step 2: Roast in the preheated oven until tender and slightly caramelized, 25 to 30 minutes.

Step 3: Place cooked vegetables into the jar of a blender. If ingredients are hot, fill blender no more than halfway full, and hold lid down with a potholder. You may have to work in batches. Add broth, harissa paste, cumin, smoked paprika, and brown sugar. Blend until smooth

Step 4: Pour blender contents into a stockpot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and serve with a swirl of heavy cream, if desired.

Name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
Ingredients: 1 (3 ½) pound butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded
1 medium leek, white portion only, chopped
1 (1 ½ inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled
1 teaspoon curry powder, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Step 2: Wrap each garlic half in foil and place on the prepared baking sheet. Add squash, cut-side down. Add onion, leek, and ginger.
Step 3: Roast in the preheated oven until vegetables are golden and squash skin is easily pierced with a fork, 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Step 4: Squeeze out roasted garlic cloves and scoop out squash flesh into a food processor or blender with onion, leek, and ginger. Add 2 cups broth and purée (in batches if necessary) until smooth. Transfer to a soup pot.

Step 5: Place the pot over medium heat and add remaining broth. Whisk in coconut milk, curry powder, and cayenne pepper. Season with salt and black pepper, and cook until heated through, about 15 minutes.

Name: Butternut Squash Soup
Ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cubed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat, and cook onion, celery, carrot, potatoes, and squash until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Pour in enough chicken stock to cover vegetables.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover pot, and simmer until all vegetables are tender, about 40 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Transfer soup to a blender and process until smooth. Return to the pot and mix in any remaining stock to reach desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Serve hot and enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
Ingredients: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed tomato soup, divided
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Meanwhile, bring a large, wide saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. Add cabbage leaves and cook for 2 to 4 minutes or until softened; drain.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Combine ground beef, 1 cup of cooked rice, onion, beaten egg, 2 tablespoons of tomato soup, salt, and pepper in a large bowl; mix thoroughly.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Spoon about 2 tablespoons of beef mixture onto each cabbage leaf.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Bring one end of the cabbage leaf over the mixture.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Roll and tuck in the ends to prevent the filling from falling out.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 9: Place cabbage rolls in a large skillet over medium heat.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 10: Pour remaining tomato soup on top
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 11: Cover and bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer for about 40 minutes, stirring and basting with the liquid often.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 12: Serve and enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Unstuffed Cabbage Roll
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Heat a Dutch oven or large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef and onion in the hot Dutch oven until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add cabbage, tomatoes, tomato sauce, water, garlic, salt, and pepper and bring to a boil. Cover Dutch oven, reduce heat, and simmer until cabbage is tender, about 30 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Serve hot and enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Cabbage Rolls
Ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, with liquid
Directions: Step 1: Wash rice thoroughly. Combine rice with 4 cups water in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until all of the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

Step 2: Meanwhile, remove cabbage cores using a thin, long knife.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Place one cabbage in a microwave-proof container with the cored part facing down. Pour 1/2 cup water into the container, cover, and microwave on high for 10 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Carefully turn cabbage over, and cook, covered, for an additional 10 minutes. Let cabbage sit until it is cool enough to handle, then separate leaves carefully and remove any tough ribs. Cook the second cabbage in the same manner.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Sauté 1/2 of the onions in 3 tablespoons butter; cook just until translucent (do not brown). Combine the cooked and uncooked rice, cooked and uncooked onions, ground beef, pork sausage, garlic, dill weed, salt, black pepper, and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Mix until incorporated.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Spoon about 2 tablespoons of mixture onto each cabbage leaf. Bring one end of the cabbage leaf over the mixture, rolling and tucking in the ends to prevent the filling from falling out.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 7: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Step 8: Place leftover cabbage leaves on the bottoms of two 9x13-inch casserole dishes. Arrange cabbage rolls in a single layer so they are tight against each other.

Step 9: Purée tomatoes and condensed tomato soup in a food processor or blender. Pour tomato mixture over the cabbage rolls until just covered. Place 4 bay leaves on top of sauce in each dish. Cover each dish tightly with foil.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven for 2 hours. Remove from the oven and let cool for 15 minutes before removing the foil. Serve hot.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Easy Lemon Cake Mix Brownies
Ingredients: 1 1/2 to 2 cups confectioners sugar, or as needed
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Lightly grease an 11x7-inch baking dish.
Step 2: Mix lemon cake mix, canola oil, eggs, and vanilla extract in a bowl until well combined. Spread the mixture in the prepared dish in an even layer.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center, 16 to 18 minutes. Allow brownies to cool for about 20 minutes.
Step 4: Meanwhile, combine 1 1/2 cups confectioner’s sugar, lemon zest, and lemon juice in a bowl; whisk until smooth; add more sugar as needed for a smooth, spreadable glaze. Stir in salt.
Step 5: Spread lemon glaze evenly over brownies and let stand until completely cooled. Refrigerate until ready to serve; cut into 12 squares.

Name: Cherry Cheesecake Dump Cake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Pour pie filling into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Step 2: Beat cream cheese, egg, sugar and vanilla together in a bowl with an electric mixer until well combined and smooth. Spoon mixture over pie filling.
Step 3: Spread cake mix in an even layer over cream cheese mixture, taking care not to mix the layers. Pour melted butter over evenly over the top.

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and bubbly, 40 to 50 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving. 
PEYTON BECKWITH

Name: Stromboli
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Preheat oven to 400° F (200° C). Grease an 10x15x1-inch baking pan; set aside. Cook and stir ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain off and discard grease.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add pepper and onion to skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Stir in ham, mushrooms and pizza sauce. Set aside.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Unroll pizza crust onto prepared baking pan. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Pat dough to a 9 x13-inch rectangle.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Lay half of the pepperoni lengthwise over half over the crust to within 1/2-inch of the edge. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Spoon meat mixture over the pepperoni.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 9: Top with cheese and remaining pepperoni.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 10: Fold dough over filling.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 11: Pinch ends and sides together  with your fingers to seal in the filling.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 12: Poke holes in the top  with the tip of a sharp knife.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 13: Brush with melted butter.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 14: Bake in a preheated oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 15: Let stand for 15 minutes before serving. Cut into four portions.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Buffalo Chicken Calzone
Ingredients: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 410 degrees F (210 degrees C). Grease a 12-inch pizza pan.

Step 2: Place chicken into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Cook chicken in boiling water until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer chicken to a bowl and shred with two forks.
Step 3: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir shredded chicken and Buffalo wing sauce in hot butter until chicken is coated and heated through, 2 to 4 minutes.

Step 4: Turn pizza dough out onto a generously floured surface. Roll dough into a 12-inch round. Brush dough with 1 tablespoon oil and sprinkle with 1 cup mozzarella cheese, leaving a 1-inch border. Spread chicken mixture over cheese; top with remaining 1 cup cheese.
Step 5: Fold pizza dough in half and pinch edges together to seal. Transfer calzone to the prepared pan and brush the top with remaining 1 tablespoon oil.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 17 to 20 minutes.

Name: Ham and Cheese Stromboli
Ingredients: 2 (16 ounce) packages refrigerated pizza crust dough
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Let dough rise according to package instructions, then punch down, and divide into 4 pieces.

Step 2: On a floured surface, roll each piece of dough into a long oval shape. Spread each with sauce, then layer with ham, capacola, salami, and pepperoni. Sprinkle with garlic powder, then top with mozzarella, onion, mushrooms and bell pepper. Bring the long sides together over the center, and pinch together to seal. Turn over, so that the seam is on the bottom, and place on an ungreased baking sheet. With a sharp knife, cut 3 diagonal slices to allow the steam to escape.
Step 3: Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown.

Name: Brown Bears
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
ALLRECIPES / ABBEY LITTLEJOHN

Step 2: Mix sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl. Pour melted butter into another bowl.
ALLRECIPES / ABBEY LITTLEJOHN

Step 3: Separate biscuits; form each dough piece into a rope 4 to 5 inches long. Wrap dough pieces around skewers.
ALLRECIPES / ABBEY LITTLEJOHN

Step 4: Hold skewers over campfire; slowly turn until biscuit dough is browned and set, 8 to 10 minutes.
ALLRECIPES / ABBEY LITTLEJOHN

Step 5: Dip biscuits into melted butter, then into cinnamon-sugar.
ALLRECIPES / ABBEY LITTLEJOHN

Name: Mediterranean Salmon Foil Packets
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons black olive tapenade or chopped pitted black olives
freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Close cover.
Step 2: Combine cherry tomatoes, olive oil, shallot, tapenade, salt, basil, thyme, and pepper in a bowl; mix well.

Step 3: Lay out foil on a work surface, shiny side-up. Place each salmon fillet skin side-down in the center of a piece of foil. Cover each piece of salmon with 1/4 of the tomato mixture. Fold up the edges of the foil over the salmon to create a packet, making sure to seal the edges well.

Step 4: Turn down the heat of the grill and carefully place the foil packets on the grate. Close the cover and cook until salmon is pale pink in the center and flakes easily with a fork, 7 to 8 minutes. Remove parcels and let them sit for a few minutes before opening.

Name: Fireside Coffee
Ingredients: 1 ½ cups instant hot chocolate mix
Directions: Step 1: Mix non-dairy creamer, instant coffee, sugar, hot chocolate mix, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a bowl.
Step 2: To use, mix 2 to 3 heaping tablespoons in a mug with hot water. Store remaining mixture in an airtight container.

Name: Pickled White Asparagus, Cucumbers, and Peppers
Ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into strips
Directions: Step 1: Divide asparagus, bell pepper, cucumber, garlic, pickling spice, and peppercorns between 2 quart-size canning jars.
Step 2: Bring water, vinegar, salt, and sugar to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Step 3: Funnel mixture into jars. Screw on lids and let sit 1 hour or until sealed. Refrigerate for a minimum of 48 hours before serving. Store pickles in the refrigerator after opening.

Name: Quick-Pickled Carrots and Radishes
Ingredients: 1 pound carrots, peeled and cut into thin sticks
1 1/2 cups white vinegar or cider vinegar
Directions: Step 1: Put vegetables in 2 (1-quart) screw-top jars (carrots in one; radishes in the other).

Step 2: Combine vinegar, water, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan; bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring to dissolve salt and sugar. Remove from heat and pour over vegetables in the jars, pressing down to fully submerge (each jar should get about half the liquid). Screw on lids and shake to combine. Chill, covered, for at least 4 hours (and up to 3 weeks).

Name: Spicy Pickled Cucumbers
Ingredients: 1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste
Directions: Step 1: Rinse cucumbers and pat dry. Trim off the ends, then slice in half. Slice each half into spears. Place spears in a clean, wide mouth mason-type canning jar.
Step 2: Add water, vinegar, and honey to a saucepan. Add about half the garlic pieces, then drop the remaining garlic into the jar with cucumber spears.

Step 3: Using a mortar and pestle, grind peppercorns, pickling spice, mustard seeds, and pepper flakes together. Sprinkle about half the mixture into the saucepan, then add remaining mixture to cucumber spears. Add as much fresh dill fronds as desired to the saucepan and also drop some into the pickle jar.

Step 4: Add salt to the saucepan. Heat on low, stirring constantly, until the honey has melted. Pour over cucumber spears, filling jar to within 1/8-inch of rim, then close the lid on tightly. Refrigerate for 1 week before using.

Name: Carrot Cake Roll
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a rimmed cookie sheet or jelly roll pan with parchment paper.
Step 2: To make the cake: Beat eggs and sugar in a mixing bowl until lighter in color; add carrot and pineapple.
Step 3: Mix flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl. Pour in egg mixture; mix until it comes together. Spread batter on the prepared baking sheet.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes.
Step 5: To make the filling: Beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract together in a bowl. Spread cream cheese filling evenly over the cooled cake. Sprinkle walnuts on top of filling.

Step 6: Run a spatula under the cake to loosen from the parchment paper. Grab the paper from one end and start rolling, pulling the paper away as you do. Roll up and refrigerate for 1 hour before cutting.

Name: Carrot Pineapple Cake
Directions: Step 1: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan.

Step 2: To make the cake: Mix flour, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the center and add sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla. Mix with a wooden spoon until smooth. Stir in carrots, coconut, walnuts, and pineapple. Pour batter into the prepared pan.

Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Allow cake to cool completely before frosting. (The center of cake may sink slightly as it cools.)

Step 4: To make the frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter in a mixing bowl until smooth. Add confectioners' sugar; beat until smooth and creamy. Spread frosting on top of cooled cake. Slice into squares and enjoy!

Name: Chef John's Carrot Cake
Ingredients: 2 cups finely grated carrots, or more to taste
1 (8 ounce) can finely crushed pineapple, drained
1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract, or to taste
3 cups confectioners' sugar, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Step 2: Place flour in a bowl. Add salt, baking soda, and baking powder. Sprinkle in ground ginger and cinnamon. Whisk thoroughly until combined. Set aside.
Step 3: Add sugar to a separate bowl. Whisk in eggs until mixture is smooth and pale yellow, 2 to 3 minutes.

Step 4: Heat butter and coconut oil in a saucepan over low heat until just melted but not too hot. Whisk into the bowl with the eggs and sugar until well combined. Add carrots, crushed pineapple, pecans, and walnuts. Stir well.

Step 5: Stir flour mixture into the carrot mixture until no dry spots remain. Pour batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking pan. Tap the pan against your counter to let any big air bubbles rise to the surface.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes. Let cool completely before frosting, at least 40 minutes.

Step 7: Beat cream cheese, butter, and vanilla extract together using an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in the confectioners' sugar to form a smooth frosting. Spread evenly over the cooled cake. Chill completely before slicing.
CHEF JOHN

Name: Rotisserie Chicken Pasta Bake
Ingredients: 6 ounces high protein pasta, such as Barilla®
8 ounces rotisserie chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
8 ounces high protein cottage cheese, such as Good Culture®
4 fluid ounces high protein milk, such as Fa!rlife®
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a casserole dish.
Step 2: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, and cook pasta for 7 minutes. Add broccoli; cook for 2 minutes more. Drain pasta and broccoli.

Step 3: Add Parmesan chunk to a high powered blender, such as a Vitamix. Blend on High until Parmesan chunk is finely ground. Add in cottage cheese, milk, and cream cheese; blend until smooth. Pour mixture into a large bowl. Stir in granulated garlic and Cantanzaro herbs. Add in the pasta, broccoli, chicken, and half the mozzarella cheese; stir until combined.
Step 4: Pour into the prepared casserole dish. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Step 5: Pour into the prepared casserole dish. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

Name: Honey Mustard Chicken and Rice Bake
Ingredients: 1/4 cup Dijon mustard or whole grain mustard
6 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)
1 1/2 cups uncooked jasmine or basmati rice
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Coat a 3-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 2: Combine 3 tablespoons honey, mustard, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 3: Add chicken to the bowl; toss to combine. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 4: Spread rice evenly in the prepared baking dish.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 5: Arrange chicken over the top. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 6: Pour broth into the same bowl and stir to combine with remaining marinade. Pour broth around chicken, being careful not to pour on top of chicken and rinse off marinade. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 7: Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and brush chicken with remaining 1 tablespoon honey.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 8: Increase oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Bake until rice is cooked and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a thigh reads at least 175 degrees F (80 degrees C.), 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions to serve.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: CHARLIE WORTHINGTON / PROP STYLING: GABRIEL GRECO

Name: Dump and Bake Meatball Casserole
Ingredients: chopped fresh herbs, such as parsley or basil (optional)
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 2: Combine pasta, water, marinara sauce, meatballs, peppers, and salt in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 3: Cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake until pasta is al dente, 30 to 35 minutes.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 4: Remove the foil and stir in 1 cup mozzarella cheese.  Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup of mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 5: Bake, uncovered, until cheese is melted, 10 minutes more.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 6: Serve garnished with fresh herbs, if desired.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Name: Garlic Shrimp Aguachile
Ingredients: 1/2 serrano chile pepper, sliced, or to taste
1/3 cup fresh lime juice, from 2 to 3 limes
1/2 pound raw shrimp - peeled, meticulously deveined, and sliced in half horizontally if large
2 tablespoons cilantro leaves, or as needed
Directions: Step 1: Combine cilantro, garlic, serrano chile, lime juice, water, salt, pepper, and sugar in a tall cup or the jar of a blender; blend with a stick blender or regular blender until smooth. Refrigerate aguachile while other ingredients are prepared.

Step 2: Add shrimp, cucumber, and red onion to a bowl, and pour in aguachile. Stir well, and press shrimp down into aguachile to cover. Wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes to 1 hour before serving.
Cook’s Note
The dish can be served immediately, but refrigerating for 30 minutes to 1 hour will achieve a more ceviche-like (“cooked”) texture. The dish can also be tightly covered and refrigerated overnight to serve the next day.

Step 3: Sprinkle aguachile with jalapeno slices and cilantro to garnish, and serve with tortilla chips.
CHEF JOHN

Name: Mexican Ceviche
Ingredients: 1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
5 large lemons, juiced, or as needed
3 fresh jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced
¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Place shrimp in a bowl. You may either coarsely chop the shrimp, or leave them whole, depending on your preference. Add lemon juice, covering shrimp completely. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until opaque and slightly firm.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add onions, tomato, cucumber, radishes, and garlic; toss to combine. Gradually add jalapeño and cilantro to desired taste (jalapeño will grow stronger while marinating).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Stir in tomato and clam juice cocktail to desired consistency.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve chilled with tortilla chips.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Crab Ceviche
Directions: Step 1: Place imitation crab into a large glass or porcelain bowl; stir in olive oil until well coated. Stir in tomatoes, serrano peppers, onion, and cilantro. Squeeze lime juice on top and mix well. Season generously with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for about 1 hour before serving.

Name: Christmas Tree Cheese Ball
Ingredients: 2 (7.5 ounce) packages pineapple flavored cream cheese spread, such as Philadelphia® brand
1/2 cup shelled pistachios, or as needed
Colby and Monterrey Jack mixed cheese cubes, to taste
6 red wax-wrapped mini cheeses, such as BabyBel®
Directions: Step 1: Spray one side of a 12-inch square piece of plastic wrap with cooking spray and place plastic, sprayed side up, on a work surface.
Step 2: Remove cream cheese spread from containers, and stack on the sprayed plastic. Lift plastic and place on spread, and mold into a cone shape using your hands.
Step 3: Carefully slide cream cheese cone onto a decorative plate.

Step 4: Dot cone with fresh raspberries, with the holes facing out. Fill each hole with a shelled pistachio, and dot the cone with pistachios. Make a row of raspberries around the bottom of the cone, gently pushing in, toward the center of the cone.
Step 5: Insert several fresh rosemary sprigs around the cone to imitate tree branches. Decorate with star-shaped baking sprinkle “ornaments,” randomly placed.
Step 6: Use cheese cubes around base of the cone to simulate packages, and add a few red wax-wrapped mini cheeses. Serve immediately, with crackers.

Name: Christmas Ornament Cheese Ball
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dill pickles, patted dry and chopped
Directions: Step 1: Mix cream cheese, Ranch-style dressing mix, dill pickles, and bacon together in a large bowl; shape mixture into a ball.
Step 2: Cover in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.
Step 3: Place chopped dill on a plate or in a shallow bowl. Remove chilled cheese ball from plastic wrap and roll the cheese ball in dill until evenly coated on all sides.

Step 4: Top with ornament top, optional. Serve with crackers.
From the Editor:
Here's an easy way to cook bacon when you only need a few strips.

Name: Cranberry Cheese Ball
Ingredients: 1 cup shredded sharp white Cheddar cheese
1/4 cup pecans, toasted and finely chopped
crackers, crostini, and/or vegetable dippers for serving
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Bring cranberry juice just to a boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat. Add 1/4 cup dried cranberries. Cover; set aside.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Place cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, and butter in a large bowl. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Drain cranberries, reserving 1 tablespoon juice. Add plumped cranberries and reserved juice to the bowl with the cheese mixture. Add 1 tablespoon chives, orange zest, brown sugar, and garlic powder. Beat with an electric mixer on medium until light and fluffy. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Place cheese mixture on a sheet of plastic wrap. Use the plastic wrap to shape the mixture into a ball (it won’t be a perfect shape at this point). Wrap in the plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 3 to 24 hours.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Now you can make a better ball shape by rolling the wrapped mixture on your work surface.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup dried cranberries, remaining 1 tablespoon chives, and the pecans on a sheet of plastic wrap or waxed paper. Roll cheese ball in the mixture to coat.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Let stand 15 minutes before serving with crackers, crostini, or vegetable dippers.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Make Ahead
Instead of refrigerating, place ball in a freezer container and freeze up to 1 month. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. Roll in coating before serving.

Name: Cheese Fondue
Ingredients: 1 (1 pound) loaf French bread, cut into 1 inch cubes
Directions:
Step 1: Bring wine to a simmer in a fondue pot over medium-low.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Stir in flour and nutmeg until well combined.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add Swiss and Gruyère cheeses, 1/4 pound at a time, mixing after each addition until cheese is melted. Season with salt.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Serve with cut-up French bread.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Best Formula Three-Cheese Fondue
Ingredients: 1 cup dry white wine (such as Sauvignon Blanc)
Directions: Step 1: Heat wine in a small saucepan over low heat until simmering.

Step 2: Meanwhile, melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour until a thick paste forms. Whisk in wine until mixture is smooth. Gradually stir in Gruyère, Cheddar, and Emmentaler cheese until melted, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Transfer cheese mixture into fondue pot. Keep warm over a low flame.

Name: Beer Cheese Fondue
Ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer
1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
Directions: Step 1: Combine Cheddar cheese, Swiss cheese, flour, salt, and black pepper in a bowl.
Step 2: Rub cut side of garlic clove around bottom and sides of fondue pot.
Step 3: Pour beer into fondue pot and slowly bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, about 5 minutes.
Step 4: Gradually stir cheese mixture into beer, adding small amounts at a time, until cheese is melted and blended, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in hot pepper sauce.

Name: 3-Ingredient Japanese Cheesecake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper.

Step 2: Place white chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove and allow to cool slightly. Mix in cream cheese and egg yolks until well combined.
Step 3: Beat egg whites in a large glass, metal, or ceramic bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Fold in cooled white chocolate mixture. Pour into the prepared springform pan.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and bake for 15 minutes. Turn the oven off, leaving cheesecake inside for 15 more minutes.
Step 5: Remove cheesecake from the oven and allow to cool completely at room temperature, about 1 hour. Chill before serving, about 3 hours.

Name: Sopapilla Cheesecake Pie
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Beat cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, and vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Unroll crescent roll dough, and use a rolling pin to shape each sheet into a 9x13-inch rectangle.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Press one piece into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Evenly spread cream cheese mixture on top.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Cover with remaining piece of crescent dough.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Mash remaining 3/4 cup sugar, butter, and cinnamon with a fork until combined.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Dot mixture over top of dough.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until crescent dough has puffed and turned golden brown, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle with honey. Cool cheesecake completely in the pan for about 2 hours before cutting into 12 squares.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Cherry Cheesecake Dump Cake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Pour pie filling into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Step 2: Beat cream cheese, egg, sugar and vanilla together in a bowl with an electric mixer until well combined and smooth. Spoon mixture over pie filling.
Step 3: Spread cake mix in an even layer over cream cheese mixture, taking care not to mix the layers. Pour melted butter over evenly over the top.

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and bubbly, 40 to 50 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving. 
PEYTON BECKWITH

Name: Spicy Lettuce Noodles
Ingredients: 6 ounces hearts of Romaine and/or Little Gem lettuce
1 tablespoon Asian fish sauce, or more to taste
2 teaspoons Asian style ground chili sauce (such as Sambal Oelek)
Directions: Step 1: Slice lettuce crosswise into 1-inch strips and transfer into a large bowl.
Step 2: Add vegetable oil to a large skillet, and place over medium-high heat.
Step 3: When the oil is hot, add shallots, green onions, and garlic, and cook and stir until shallots start to turn translucent, about 2 minutes.

Step 4: Add brown sugar, rice vinegar, fish sauce, tamarind paste, soy sauce, chili sauce, and Sriracha, and stir to combine. As soon as the sauce starts to boil, turn off heat and set aside until needed.

Step 5: Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until barely tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes, or about 30 seconds less than package directions.
Step 6: Use tongs to transfer noodles into the pan of sauce, and cook, stirring, over medium-high heat for about 30 seconds.
Step 7: Transfer noodles and sauce to the bowl of lettuce, and toss until everything is evenly combined, about 1 minute, or longer if you prefer the lettuce more wilted.

Step 8: Serve with fresh lime, more hot sauce, and freshly chopped cilantro if desired.
CHEF JOHN
Chef's Note:
How sweet, sour, spicy, and salty this dish is, is up to you. More fish sauce can be added for a saltier, more intense version, but if you’re new to using an Asian fish sauce be careful, and start slowly. You can always add more to the finished noodles. Same goes for the tamarind, and the spicy ingredients.

Name: Fajita Cheeseburger
Ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1/4 red onion, cut into thick slices
Directions: Step 1: Stir chili powder, paprika, cayenne, cumin, oregano, garlic powder, and onion powder together in a small bowl; set aside until needed.
Step 2: Shape ground beef into a burger as thick as you like, but preferably thinner to increase surface area, and season generously on both sides with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until needed.

Step 3: Melt butter with olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Once butter begins to sizzle, transfer in the burger. Add jalapeno, tomato, and red onion around the burger and arrange so vegetables are all touching the pan. Season vegetables to taste with salt.
Step 4: Cook burger for about 3 minutes, then apply a very generous sprinkling of fajita spice mixture over burger and vegetables.

Step 5: Turn burger and vegetables once they begin to brown around the edges. Generously sprinkle fajita spice over burger and vegetables, and cook until burger is no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). If vegetables finish cooking before burger, remove them to a plate and keep warm.
Step 6: Meanwhile, spread the bun inside and out with mayonnaise and toast in a dry pan over medium- high heat until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes.

Step 7: When the burger is almost done, top with a slice of cheese. Let cook for about 30 seconds. Pile fajita vegetables over cheese. Serve on toasted bun with a lime wedge.
JOHN MITZEWICH
Chef's Note:
You can also toast the bun in the pan you’re planning to use before you start cooking the burger.
Fajita seasoning mix makes enough to season 4 burgers, while the recipe is for 1 burger.

Name: Corned Beef Kimchi Fried Rice
Ingredients: 1 ¼ cups kimchi, or to taste
1 ½ cups diced fully cooked corned beef
2 teaspoons sesame oil, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Drain kimchi over a pot, reserving the juice.
Step 2: Meanwhile, coat a pan with olive oil and add corned beef.

Step 3: Chop kimchi into small chunks; add to the pan. Place pan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until mixture is browned to your liking, 4 to 7 minutes. Add rice, kimchi juice, water, and gochujang.

Step 4: Mix rice mixture together and spread evenly over the pan; cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Mix and pat rice down again. Continue cooking, mixing and pressing rice every 3 to 4 minutes, until evenly browned and crusty, 12 to 15 minutes total.
Step 5: Mix green onion, sesame seeds, and sesame oil into the fried rice. Taste and season with soy sauce. Stir again. Transfer fried rice to serving bowls.

Name: These Homemade Cherry Tarts Are Sure to Sweeten Your Day
Ingredients: 1/2 cup whipped cream, or as needed (optional)
grated chocolate as needed for garnish (optional)
Directions: Step 1: Place pie crusts on a lightly floured surface and roll out each crust with a rolling pin, so it is large enough to cut three 5 to 5-1/2-inch circles, for a total of 6 tart crusts.

Step 2: Fit each dough circle into a 4-inch removable-bottom tart pan. Press the dough against the sides of the pans, and prick the bottom with a fork to prevent bubbling. Remove any excess dough by running the rolling pin across the top of each pan.
Step 3: Refrigerate tart crusts until well chilled, about 45 minutes, keeping them refrigerated until ready to use.
Step 4: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Step 5: In a large bowl, combine cherries, tapioca, sugar, almond extract, and salt. Remove the pans from the fridge and distribute cherry mixture evenly among the tart pans. Place the pans on a baking sheet.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until cherries are soft and crust is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.

Name: Old-Time Mincemeat Pie
Ingredients: 1 ¼ pounds round steak, cut into small pieces
4 Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and finely diced
½ pound chopped candied mixed fruit peel
1 (16 ounce) can pitted sour cherries, drained
1 (14.1 ounce) package double-crust pie pastry, thawed
Directions: Step 1: Combine steak and cider in a Dutch oven. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook until steak is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove steak to a cutting board; coarsely chop, then return to the pot.

Step 2: Stir in apples, currants, raisins, cherry preserves, 1 1/3 cups sugar, mixed fruit peel, and butter. Add ginger, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt. Simmer, uncovered, over low heat until mixture is very thick, about 1 hour 30 minutes. Stir in cherries and remove from heat.
Step 3: Transfer filling to a container and allow to cool at room temperature. Cover tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 week before using.
Step 4: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 5: Line a 9-inch pie dish with 1 pastry crust. Spoon filling into crust and cover with second pastry crust. Crimp edges and cut several slits into top pastry. Brush with cream and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon sugar.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 45 minutes.

Name: Cherry Pie
Directions:
Step 1: Gather the ingredients.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 2: Whisk flour and salt together in a bowl. Cut in shortening with 2 knives or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 3: Mix in cold water by hand just until dough holds together. Divide dough in half and form into disks. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, 30 minutes to 1 hour.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 4: Roll out 1 dough disk into an 11-inch circle and press it into a 9-inch pie dish. Place in the refrigerator until needed.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 5: Roll out remaining dough disk into an 11-inch circle for the top crust, transfer it to a plate or baking sheet, and refrigerate until needed. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place a baking tray in the oven to preheat.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 6: Place cherries, sugar, and cornstarch in a medium, non-aluminum saucepan. Allow mixture to stand until juices begin to release, about 10 minutes.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 7: Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Lower the heat and simmer until juices thicken and become translucent, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in butter and almond extract. Allow filling to cool to lukewarm.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 8: Pour cooled filling into prepared pie crust. Cover with top crust, trim and crimp the edges to seal, and cut vents for steam.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven on the preheated baking tray until crust is golden brown, 45 to 55 minutes. Allow to cool for several hours before slicing.
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Step 10: Serve with a scoop of ice cream and enjoy!
ALLRECIPES / ANA CADENA

Name: Chess Pie
Directions:
Step 1: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Mix butter, sugar, and vanilla together in a large bowl. Mix in eggs, then stir in evaporated milk, cornmeal, and vinegar until smooth.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Pour into pie shell.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and continue to bake for 40 minutes. Let pie cool before cutting.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Chocolate Chess Pie
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 2: Mix sugar and cocoa together in a large bowl. Beat eggs in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy; stir into cocoa mixture. Beat in evaporated milk, butter, and vanilla. Pour mixture into unbaked pie crust.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 45 minutes. Let cool before slicing.

Name: Buttermilk Chess Pie
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.)
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine sugar and flour. Beat in the eggs and buttermilk until blended. Stir in the melted butter and vanilla. Pour filling into the pie crust.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set, about 45 minutes.

Name: Famous Chicken Adobo
Ingredients: ⅔ cup low sodium soy sauce
Directions:
Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken pieces until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Add onion and garlic to the skillet; cook until softened and brown, about 3 to 5 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 3: Pour in soy sauce and vinegar and season with garlic powder, black pepper, and bay leaf.

Step 4: Return chicken to pan, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until chicken is tender and cooked through, 35 to 40 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Chicken Adobo Tacos
Ingredients: 1 pinch ground white pepper, or to taste
1/4 cup minced jalapeno pepper, seeds and membranes removed
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste
chopped cilantro and sliced green onions, for garnish (optional)
Directions: Step 1: Combine soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaves, and garlic in a large plastic bag with a zipper. Gently squeeze to mix well. Add chicken and coat with marinade. Squeeze out as much air from the bag as possible, coat all the chicken pieces with marinade, seal, and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes.

Step 2: Meanwhile, combine vinegar, fish sauce, avocado oil, sugar, and black pepper in a bowl for the salsa. Stir with a whisk or fork until sugar is dissolved. Add mango, tomato, red onion, jalapeño, and chopped cilantro to the bowl. Toss to combine, and refrigerate salsa until ready to serve.
Step 3: For tacos, remove chicken pieces from the marinade and reserve the marinade.
Step 4: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Carefully add the chicken thighs, and brown on each side, 1 to 2 minutes, then remove chicken to a plate.

Step 5: To the same skillet, add onion, and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add reserved marinade, water, brown sugar, and black pepper, and bring to a boil.

Step 6: Return chicken to the skillet, smooth side down. Reduce heat to low, and simmer chicken uncovered, about 15 minutes. The liquid should bubble gently. Turn chicken and simmer 10 minutes more. Remove chicken from skillet to rest.
Step 7: Cook sauce over medium heat until syrupy, thick, and reduced, about 10 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Remove bay leaves and discard.
Step 8: Slice chicken into 1/2-inch slices and return to the skillet to coat in the sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro and chopped green onions, if desired.
Step 9: Fill each tortilla with chicken strips and top with mango salsa. Serve immediately.

Name: Instant Pot Filipino Chicken Adobo
Ingredients: 1 ½ pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs
Directions: Step 1: Whisk together vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, olive oil, brown sugar, and crushed peppercorns in a medium bowl until sugar is dissolved. Stir in bay leaves.
Step 2: Line the bottom of a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) with onion slices. Place chicken thighs over onion and pour vinegar mixture over the top. Close and lock the lid.
Step 3: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 minutes for pressure to build.
Step 4: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Step 5: Release pressure using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Using tongs, transfer chicken thighs to the prepared baking sheet, skin-side up. Select Sauté function and cook until sauce thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.
Step 6: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to high.
Step 7: Cook chicken under the preheated broiler until skin is crispy, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer chicken to a serving plate and spoon sauce over the top. Garnish with scallions.

Name: Rustic Chicken and Dumplin's
Ingredients: 1 whole chicken, cut into pieces (drumsticks, thighs, and halved breasts)
1 teaspoon Morton Nature’s Seasons seasoning blend
3 medium carrots, cut into 1-inch pieces (1 1/2 cups)
3 medium stalks celery, cut into 1-inch pieces (1 1/2 cups)
1 1/4 cups flour, plus more for dusting
1/2 cup butter, chilled and cut into thin slices
Directions: Step 1: Season chicken pieces all over with the Morton’s seasoning blend.

Step 2: Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add chicken pieces, skin sides down, and cook until golden brown, 6 to 8 minutes. Turn chicken pieces and brown again, 6 to 8 minutes more.

Step 3: Add broth and water; bring to a boil over high heat. Add onion, poultry seasoning, garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, 20 minutes. Add carrots and celery. Leaving pot partially covered, continue simmering over low heat until vegetables are almost tender, about 20 minutes.
Step 4: Meanwhile, sift flour, baking powder, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt together in a large bowl. In a separate medium bowl, whisk together egg and buttermilk.

Step 5: Cut chilled butter into dry mixture using a pastry cutter or two forks. Blend well to a crumbly consistency. Add buttermilk mixture and gently stir with a wooden spoon until combined. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes.

Step 6: Turn out dough onto a floured surface. Using your hands, pat dough to approximately 1-inch thickness and gently fold outer edges into center. Continue to gently fold—do not knead—until it comes together. Pat dough out again to approximately 1-inch thickness.

Step 7: Remove cooked chicken from Dutch oven (an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part of chicken should register 170 degrees F /76 degrees C) and put it on a plate. Cover with foil to keep warm. Skim fat from broth. Bring broth to a gentle boil over medium-high heat.

Step 8: Using a knife, cut dough into 9 (2x2-inch) squares. Gently drop each square, one at a time, into boiling broth. Lower heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, until all dumplings rise to top and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 10 minutes. Return chicken to pot and simmer an additional 5 minutes.
