Step 3: Reduce the oven temperature to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Slice rolls in half lengthwise. Spread 2 tablespoons butter over the cut side of bottom half of rolls. Top evenly with brown sugar and cayenne pepper. Arrange bacon slices over brown sugar mixture.
Step 4: Spread 1 tablespoon butter evenly into the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Place the prepared sandwich half in the buttered pan.

Step 5: Whisk eggs, half-and-half, vanilla, salt, and syrup together in a separate 9x13-inch baking dish. Add top half of rolls to egg mixture and turn a couple times to coat and lightly soak the bread. Allow the excess egg mixture to drip off and place top half of rolls over bacon layer. Cover with foil. Discard any excess egg mixture.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake until golden brown and lightly toasted, 5 to 10 minutes more.
Step 7: Spread remaining butter over the tops. Cut into 12 servings. Dust with confectioner's sugar. Serve with syrup for dipping.

Name: Individual Bourbon-Pecan French Toast Bakes
Ingredients: 4 cups dry whole-grain or challah bread cubes (see From the Editor, below)
Directions: Step 1: Grease 4 (8 to 10 ounce) ramekins. Whisk together milk, eggs, maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl. Add bread. Toss to combine. Divide among prepared ramekins. Chill, covered, at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
Step 2: Meanwhile, make Toasted Pecan Butter: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spread pecans on a rimmed baking sheet.
Step 3: Toast in the preheated oven, stirring once or twice, until lightly browned and fragrant, 12 to 15 minutes. Watch closely so they don’t burn. Let cool to room temperature.

Step 4: Pulse butter, brown sugar, and vanilla in a food processor until combined. Add cooled pecans. Pulse until mixture reaches desired consistency. Chill Toasted Pecan Butter in an airtight container up to 1 month.

Step 5: To assemble: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). For streusel, stir together flour and brown sugar in a medium bowl. Cut in butter with a pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs; stir in pecans. Sprinkle streusel over bread mixture in ramekins.

Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and a knife inserted into centers comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Serve warm with Toasted Pecan Butter and garnish with powdered sugar.
From the Editor:
To make dry bread cubes, preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Cut 8 ounces fresh bread into 3/4-inch cubes. Spread cubes on a 10x15-inch rimmed baking sheet. Bake, stirring twice, until dry, 10 to 15 minutes. Let cool (cubes will continue to crisp). Alternatively, let bread cubes stand, loosely covered, at room temperature until dry, 8 to 12 hours.
Toasted Pecan Butter recipe submitted by Carrie Mae.

Name: Copycat Chicken Crispers with Honey Chipotle Dipping Sauce
Ingredients: 4 cups vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
1 chipotle pepper, finely chopped, plus 1 tablespoon adobo sauce from the can
Directions: Step 1: Cut chicken breasts into strips about 3 inches long.
Step 2: Stir buttermilk and hot sauce together in a medium bowl. Add chicken to buttermilk mixture and toss well to completely cover the chicken. Let stand 30 minutes.
Step 3: Meanwhile, pour vegetable oil into a large saucepan or very deep skillet to about 4 inches deep.  Heat oil to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Step 4: In a large shallow dish, whisk together flour, kosher salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and baking powder until well combined.

Step 5: Remove each tender from buttermilk mixture and coat lightly with flour mixture, shaking off any excess. Return chicken to buttermilk mixture and finish with a second coat of flour mixture. Set aside on a plate. Repeat with remaining chicken pieces.

Step 6: Working in batches, carefully add chicken tenders to hot oil and cook, flipping occasionally, until crispy golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes.  Drain on paper towels or a wire rack set over a rimmed baking sheet.

Step 7: For sauce, whisk barbecue sauce, chipotle pepper, adobo sauce, and honey together in a small bowl. Season to taste with salt. Serve chicken with sauce.
From the Editor
Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of breading ingredients. The actual amount of breading consumed will vary. We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used.

Name: Bang Bang Chicken Nuggets
Ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts and/or thighs
3 cups vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
3 tablespoons Sriracha hot sauce, plus more for serving
Directions: Step 1: Cut chicken into about 1 to 1 1/2- inch pieces; add to the bowl of a food processor. Add breadcrumbs, salt, paprika, black pepper, cayenne, garlic powder, and the 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to the food processor, and pulse on and off until mixture is finely ground, but not yet a smooth puree.

Step 2: Scoop 2 tablespoon-sized portions onto a sheet pan, making 24 total. Cover and chill for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, shake self-rising flour and cornstarch together in a bag, and set aside (if using all-purpose flour, add in 1/2 teaspoon baking soda).

Step 3: Using slightly damp hands, shape each portion into a ball; add 5 to 6 at a time to the flour mixture in the bag. Toss to coat, shake off excess, and place back on the sheet pan. Once coated, form each into the nugget shape of your choice. A ball shape works well for deep frying; if pan-frying, a flat nugget works best.
Step 4: Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 to 2 hours, or until ready to fry. Nuggets can be made a day ahead.
Step 5: While nuggets chill, whisk mayonnaise, honey, Sriracha, soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and Sichuan pepper together in a bowl; cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Step 6: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Deep fry nuggets until no longer pink at the center and golden brown on the outside, about 4 minutes. An instant read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C. Alternately, heat oil as needed in a skillet over medium-high heat, and shallow fry until cooked as above, 2 to 3 minutes per side.

Step 7: Transfer cooked nuggets to a mixing bowl, and add half the sliced green onions. Pour in about 1/2 cup sauce, and toss to coat. Extra sauce can be served alongside, or used for other applications—as sandwich spread or as a dip.

Step 8: Transfer to a serving platter, top with more Sriracha and remaining green onions. Serve immediately.
JOHN MITZEWICH
From the Editor
Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of  breading ingredients. The actual amount of breading consumed will vary. We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used.

Name: Air Fryer Lemon Garlic Parmesan Chicken
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 2: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Step 3: Place chicken in a large bowl. Add garlic, lemon zest, paprika, oregano, salt, and crushed red pepper; toss to coat chicken in the seasonings.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Combine Parmesan cheese and panko in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken in Parmesan mixture to coat. Sprinkle any remaining mixture over chicken; pat to adhere. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Coat the chicken generously with cooking spray. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Lightly coat air fryer basket with cooking spray. Place chicken in prepared basket (cook in batches, if needed). Air fry 12 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the center reads 170 degrees F (77 degrees C).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Serve immediately.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Recipe Tip
Serve with a simple salad. Whisk together 3 tablespoons lemon juice, 3 tablespoons olive oil, and 1 tablespoon honey in a large bowl. Add 6 cups baby arugula and/or baby spinach and toss to coat.

Name: Corned Beef Kimchi Fried Rice
Ingredients: 1 ¼ cups kimchi, or to taste
1 ½ cups diced fully cooked corned beef
2 teaspoons sesame oil, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Drain kimchi over a pot, reserving the juice.
Step 2: Meanwhile, coat a pan with olive oil and add corned beef.

Step 3: Chop kimchi into small chunks; add to the pan. Place pan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until mixture is browned to your liking, 4 to 7 minutes. Add rice, kimchi juice, water, and gochujang.

Step 4: Mix rice mixture together and spread evenly over the pan; cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Mix and pat rice down again. Continue cooking, mixing and pressing rice every 3 to 4 minutes, until evenly browned and crusty, 12 to 15 minutes total.
Step 5: Mix green onion, sesame seeds, and sesame oil into the fried rice. Taste and season with soy sauce. Stir again. Transfer fried rice to serving bowls.

Name: Chicken Adobo Fried Rice
Ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice, grains separated (see Note)
2 teaspoons sesame oil, or to taste
1 tablespoon soy sauce, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Pour oil into a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat. When oil is hot, add onions and stir about 1 minute. Add garlic and stir about 30 seconds.
Step 2: Stir in frozen green peas and matchstick carrots and cook, stirring, 3 to 4 minutes. Add rice and stir in sesame oil and soy sauce. Cook, stirring, about 2 minutes.
Step 3: Stir in chicken, using a lifting motion, to make sure all the rice is coated with any sauce from the chicken adobo. Cook and stir about 2 minutes. Season with salt and white pepper.

Step 4: Move the skillet contents to one side of the skillet and pour in beaten egg. Allow egg to spread into a thin layer. When egg is set, score into strips, then stir into rice mixture. Remove from heat. Sprinkle on chopped scallions and serve warm.
Cook’s Note
Cooked leftover rice works best for fried rice. Spread leftover rice out on a piece of parchment or foil to separate the grains, leaving no clumps. Clean fingers work best for this task.

Name: Hot Dog Fried Rice
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon soy sauce, plus more to taste
Directions: Step 1: Heat oil over high in a large deep skillet or wok. Add onions and cook until lightly browned and softened, about 2 minutes. Add hot dogs and cook, stirring constantly until browned. Add in rice and sesame oil and cook, stirring constantly, about 1 minute. Stir in ginger, garlic, salt and pepper.

Step 2: Spread mixture into an even layer and cook, undisturbed, until rice is lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Add in mixed vegetables and stir, then cook undisturbed for 2 minutes. Push rice mixture to the sides and create a space in the center of the skillet. Add butter to the skillet and allow to melt. Crack in eggs and cook, stirring only the eggs until they are soft scrambled. Fold eggs into rice mixture and stir until evenly mixed. Stir in vinegar and soy sauce and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat.

Step 3: Combine mayo, Sriracha and lemon juice in a small bowl. Serve fried rice topped with a drizzle of mayo mixture and sprinkle with green onions.
DOTDASH MEREDITH VIDEO STUDIOS

Name: Loaded Sriracha Fries
Ingredients: 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch fries
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 2: Place cut fries in a large bowl. Cover with cold water and let stand for 20 minutes.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 3: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and line a large baking sheet with foil. 
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 4: Drain potatoes, rinse, and drain in a colander. Place potatoes back in the bowl.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 5: Whisk oil and Sriracha in a small bowl until smooth. Pour mixture over potatoes. Toss to coat.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 6: Arrange fries in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Flip fries and bake for 10 minutes more.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 7: Pile fries up into the center of the baking sheet with a spatula. Add shredded Cheddar and bacon bits. Return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Step 8: Top with chopped green onions and serve immediately.
ALLRECIPES/QI AI

Name: Air Fryer Sriracha Fries
Directions: Step 1: Cut potatoes into fries. Place cut fries into a bowl of water; soak for 1 hour.
Step 2: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with paper towels and set a wire rack over the sheet.
Step 3: Preheat the air fryer to 375 degrees F according to manufacturer’s instructions.
Step 4: Drain fries, and pat dry with a paper towel. Place fries in a resealable plastic bag. Add oil, 1 tablespoon Sriracha, and salt. Seal the bag and toss to coat.
Step 5: Add fries to bottom of air fryer basket in a single flat layer, not stacked. You will have to work in batches.
Step 6: Air fry until crispy and golden brown, about 13 minutes.
Step 7: Place fries on the prepared baking sheet; keep warm in the preheated oven. Repeat with remaining fries.

Step 8: Place fries on a platter; drizzle with remaining sriracha. Enjoy.
Cook’s Note
I bought an electronic French fry cutter online. I highly recommend it to get perfectly uniform shape fries.
Soaking the fries removes excess starch and allows them to crisp up.

Name: Loaded Kimchi Fries
Ingredients: 1 (8-ounce) container fresh small mozzarella cheese balls
1/4 cup original cheese dip (such as Cheez Whiz)
3 tablespoons hot sauce (such as Sriracha chile sauce)
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) with racks in top third and lower third positions.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Toss together fries and oil in a large bowl until well coated. Spread fries in a single layer on prepared baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown and crisp, about 35 minutes, stirring fries and rotating pans front to back and between top and bottom racks twice during bake time.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Consolidate fries onto one baking sheet, arranging them into an even layer. Top fries evenly with mozzarella balls. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) in top third of oven until cheese is slightly melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Meanwhile, place cheese dip in a small microwave-safe medium bowl, and microwave on HIGH until warm and melted, about 45 seconds, stirring after 30 seconds. Add mayonnaise to cheese dip; stir until combined.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Evenly drizzle cheese dip mixture and hot sauce over french fry mixture and top with kimchi and scallions.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Divide between plates and serve immediately.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Egg Bites
Ingredients: 5 small tri-color baby potatoes, thinly sliced
1 small yellow bell pepper, finely chopped
1 slice mozzarella cheese, cut into 12 cubes
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray.
Step 2: Place a thin layer of potato slices in the bottom of each muffin cup. Add a little butter on top.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.
Step 4: Mix together eggs, bell pepper, tomato, spinach, ham, and onion in a large bowl. Ladle egg mixture over warm potatoes. Top each muffin cup with a mozzarella cube.

Step 5: Continue baking until eggs are set, about 20 minutes.
FRANCE C

Name: Pesto Spaghetti Frittata
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons prepared pesto, plus more for garnish
1 pound frozen mixed carrots, broccoli, zucchini, and cauliflower (such as Normandy® blend)
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Step 2: Whisk eggs, Parmesan cheese, half and half, ricotta, pesto, thyme, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.
Step 3: Place vegetables in a microwave-safe bowl; cook on High in the microwave until thawed, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain well.
Step 4: Melt butter in an ovenproof nonstick skillet. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add steamed vegetables, and toss to coat.
Step 5: Pour half of egg mixture into the skillet. Toss cooked spaghetti with remaining egg mixture. Pour egg-coated pasta into the skillet. Cook 5 minutes.

Step 6: Bake in the skillet in the preheated oven until eggs are firm, about 25 minutes. Remove, cut into wedges, and serve with more pesto if desired.
From the Editor:
Duck eggs can be found at farmer's markets. They are larger than chicken eggs, and the yolks are proportionately larger, so they are more rich. You'll need about 8 large chicken eggs to substitute for 6 duck eggs.

Name: Halloumi and Zucchini Frittata
Ingredients: 1 large zucchini, grated and squeezed dry
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Heat olive oil in a small, ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini and a pinch of salt and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add chopped mint and dill, and cook 1 minute more.

Step 2: Beat eggs with salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour into the hot skillet with the zucchini and briefly stir. Cook without stirring to allow the bottom of the frittata to set, about 2 minutes. Use a spatula around the edges of the skillet to ensure that the frittata isn't sticking as the bottom starts to set.
Step 3: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.

Step 4: Lay the slices of halloumi on the top of the frittata as the edges start to set. Place the skillet under the broiler until the top of the frittata is fully set and cheese is slightly browned, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

Name: Funfetti Cheesecake Sandwich Cookies
Ingredients: 8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
3/4 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
1 extra large egg, at room temperature
1 1/2 cups finely ground graham cracker crumbs (from about 12 crackers)
1/2 cup red, pink, and white jimmie sprinkles
8 ounces full fat cream cheese, at room temperature
1 tablespoons red, pink, and white jimmie sprinkles
Directions: Step 1: For cookies, beat butter and cream cheese together with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Add in brown sugar, white sugar, salt, nutmeg, and cinnamon and beat until smooth and combined. Add in egg, vanilla, and almond extract and beat until smooth and combined.

Step 2: Add in graham cracker crumbs and beat until incorporated. Add in 1 3/4 cups flour, corn starch, and baking powder and mix until just combined. Add in remaining 1 cup flour and mix until just combined. Add in 1/2 cup jimmies and stir until incorporated.
Step 3: Divide dough in half and place each half onto a piece of plastic wrap. Use the plastic wrap to flatten each dough half into a 1/2-inch thick disc, cover, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

Step 4: Flour a work surface, and roll out dough, 1 disc at a time, 1/8-inch thick. Cut out shapes with a 3 1/2-inch heart-shaped cutter. Press dough scraps back together, re-roll and re-cut as needed. Place cut-outs on a flat surface, then place them into fridge to chill for about 30 minutes.
Step 5: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line baking sheets with silicone baking mats or parchment paper.
Step 6: Remove cut-outs from the refrigerator, and space 1 inch apart on baking sheets.
Step 7: Bake until cookies look just set, 6 to 9 minutes. Cool on pan for 5 minutes before carefully removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Step 8: For filling, beat butter with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in cream cheese until completely smooth and combined. Add in 1 cup confectioner’s sugar, vanilla, salt, and almond extract and beat until completely smooth and combined. Add remaining powdered sugar, 1 cup at a time, beating after each addition until smooth. Add lemon juice and heavy cream, and beat frosting for another 2 to 3 minutes on medium-high speed. Fold in sprinkles.

Step 9: Flip one heart cookie over, and spread or pipe some of the frosting evenly over the bottom of the cookie. Top with another cookie and lightly press together to adhere. Repeat this process of filling and sandwiching cookies together until all the cookies and frosting are used up. Refrigerate cookie sandwiches until ready to eat.

Name: Sugar Cookie Tree Stacks with Cream Cheese Frosting
Ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
sanding or sparkling sugar, as needed for finishing
8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/4 cup sour cream, at room temperature
sprinkles and/or more sanding sugar, as needed for decorating
5 drops green food coloring, or more as needed (optional)
Directions: Step 1: Line 4 baking sheets with parchment paper (see Note).

Step 2: Combine butter, granulated sugar and brown sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Cream until light and fluffy, 4 to 5 minutes. Add egg and vanilla extract, and mix on medium speed until well incorporated, scraping down the sides of the bowl to incorporate all the ingredients well.
Step 3: Add flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt and mix on low speed until combined. Scrape the bowl well, then mix on low speed again until a smooth, homogeneous dough forms.
Step 4: Pour sanding or sparkling sugar in a shallow bowl. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) with the oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven.

Step 5: To create the trees you will need cookies in 3 different sizes. Portion out 22 scoops of dough in each of the following sizes: 1 teaspoon, 2 teaspoons, and 1 tablespoon and set on the prepared baking sheets. Keep same size dough portions together on the same baking sheet and divide the 1 tablespoon cookie dough portions amongst 2 baking sheets.

Step 6: Use your hands to roll each dough portion into a ball, then roll dough balls through the sanding or sparkling sugar to generously coat. Return cookies to the baking sheets, spacing them at least 1 inch apart.

Step 7: Working in batches, transfer baking sheets to the preheated oven. Bake until cookies are lightly golden brown at the very edge, 5 to 7 minutes for the smallest cookies, 6 to 8 minutes for medium-sized cookies, and 7 to 9 minutes for the largest ones. Carefully transfer cookies to wire racks and cool completely.

Step 8: Combine cream cheese and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Cream until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Scrape the bowl well, then add powdered sugar in 3 to 4 additions, mixing well and scraping the bowl after each addition. Add the vanilla, salt, and sour cream and mix on medium speed to combine. Stop the mixer and scrape the bowl well, then mix again on medium speed to make sure everything is evenly combined. Add food coloring and mix until frosting is evenly colored. Add more green food coloring for a deeper color.

Step 9: Fit a pastry bag with a medium star tip (such as Ateco 20, 21, or 22) or medium round tip (such as Ateco 9, 10, or 11). Transfer some of the frosting to the pastry bag, aiming to fill it no more than halfway full.

Step 10: To assemble the cookie stacks place the largest cookies on a parchment lined baking sheet. Hold the pastry bag directly over each cookie and pipe on enough frosting to cover the surface of the cookie, leaving about 1/2 inch uncovered around the outer edge. Repeat with all of the largest cookies. Place a medium cookie on top of each frosted large cookie and press down slightly - the frosting should now come just barely to the outer edge.

Step 11: Frost medium sized cookies the same way you frosted the large cookies, leaving about 1/2 inch uncovered around the outer edges. Set a small cookie on top of each cookie stack, pressing down lightly to spread the frosting just barely to the outer edges.

Step 12: Pipe a tall swirl of frosting on top of each cookie stack, like you would on a cupcake, to create the top of the “tree”. Decorate the exposed frosting with sprinkles and/or more sparkling sugar.

Step 13: Store in an airtight container until ready to serve - the stacks taste best within 5 days of assembling.
Cook’s Note
If you don’t have 4 baking sheets, you can bake the cookies in batches.

Name: Pink Velvet Cake
Ingredients: 1 (15.25-ounce) package classic white cake mix (such as Pillsbury)
6 drops soft pink food coloring gel (such as Americolor)
1/4 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly coat a 9x13-inch baking pan with baking spray; set aside.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Whisk together cake mix, buttermilk, oil, eggs, and food coloring in a medium bowl until fully combined and no dry streaks remain. Transfer to the prepared baking pan and spread in an even layer.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool completely in pan on a wire rack, about 1 hour.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Beat cream cheese and butter with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Gradually beat in powdered sugar with mixer on low speed, until smooth and fully combined, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl as needed, about 3 minutes. Add vanilla and salt and beat until just combined.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Using an offset spatula, spread cream cheese frosting evenly over the top of the cooled cake. Garnish with sprinkles, if desired.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Cut into squares and serve.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Summer Fruit Salad with Mint Dressing
Ingredients: 2 large fresh peaches, cut into cubes
1 red Anjou pear, cut into cubes
¼ cup minced fresh mint (chocolate mint preferred)
Directions: Step 1: Combine watermelon, strawberries, peaches, nectarines, pear, and grapes in a large mixing bowl.
Step 2: Whisk lemon juice, mint, lemon zest, and honey together in a small bowl; drizzle over the fruit mixture and toss to coat.
Step 3: For best results, refrigerate the fruit salad for 1 hour before serving.

Name: Citrus and Pomegranate Salad
Ingredients: ¼ cup frozen lemonade concentrate, undiluted
Directions: Step 1: Peel grapefruits, oranges, and tangerines with a serrated edge knife, being careful to remove the white pith.
Step 2: Slice all citrus fruit crossways and remove any seeds. Evenly distribute slices amongst 4 salad plates. Sprinkle pomegranate arils evenly over each salad.
Step 3: Stir together sour cream and undiluted lemonade concentrate in a small bowl for the dressing until smooth. Drizzle dressing over each salad. Garnish with mint sprigs.

Name: Balsamic Grape and Walnut Salad
Directions: Step 1: In a medium serving bowl, combine the grapes, walnuts, onion, green onion, radishes and raisins. Toss with balsamic vinaigrette dressing just before serving.

Name: Christmas Cake
Ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) container candied mixed citrus peel
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 2: Combine candied cherries, citrus peel, and almonds in a medium bowl. Add raisins, currants, and dates; pour in brandy and stir to combine. Cover and let sit for 2 hours or overnight.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 3: When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). Grease a deep 8-inch fruitcake pan, line it with parchment paper, and grease again.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 4: Dredge brandy-soaked fruit with 1/2 cup flour.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 5: Whisk together remaining 2 cups flour, cloves, allspice, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 6: Stir molasses and apple juice together in a separate bowl until combined.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 7: Cream butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Gradually blend in brown sugar and eggs.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 8: Add flour mixture in 4 batches, alternating with molasses mixture.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 9: Fold in floured fruit, then turn batter into the prepared pan.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 3 to 3 1/2 hours.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Step 11: Remove cake from the pan, and lift off the parchment paper. Cool cake completely, then wrap loosely in waxed paper. Store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to 2 months, or in the refrigerator for longer.
ALLRECIPES / DIANA CHISTRUGA

Name: Best Boiled Fruitcake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Line an 8-inch deep cake pan with parchment paper.

Step 2: Place sugar, candied mixed fruit, milk, butter, cherries, citrus peel, walnuts, allspice, and baking soda in a medium-sized saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly.
Step 3: Stir flour and eggs into fruit mixture. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Wrap the outside of the pan with brown paper or newspaper.
Step 4: Bake cake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Reduce temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and continue baking cake for 1 1/2 hours.

Step 5: Let cake sit at room temperature for 5 minutes, then invert it onto a wired rack. Remove parchment paper, flip cake, and allow to cool completely on the rack. Cake may be stored wrapped in foil and in an airtight container for up to 6 months.

Name: Sharon's Jamaican Fruit Cake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.

Step 2: Place butter and sugar into a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Beat in eggs; add rum, lime juice, almond extract, vanilla, and lime zest.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Stir in dried fruit, wine and molasses.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Sift flour, baking powder, nutmeg, allspice, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl; gently fold into fruit mixture. Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 80 to 90 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.

Name: Gingerbread Fudge
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with aluminum foil and lightly grease or butter the foil; set aside. 
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Set aside 1/2 cup white chocolate chips. Combine remaining white chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, molasses, and butter in a saucepan set over medium heat. Stir frequently until butter and chocolate chips are completely melted and ingredients are combined.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Add vanilla extract, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, cloves and salt; stir well to combine.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Pour mixture into the prepared pan and smooth out evenly.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Working quickly, microwave the remaining 1/2 cup white chocolate chips in a small microwave-safe bowl until melted, 1 to 1 1/2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Spoon dollops of the white chocolate mixture atop the fudge and use a knife to gently swirl the 2 mixtures together.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Cover and chill about 2 hours or until firm.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 9: Use foil to lift uncut fudge out of the pan; cut into 1-inch squares. Makes 2 pounds 6 ounces.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Easiest Peanut Butter Fudge
Directions:
Step 1: Gather the ingredients.
WILL DICKEY / FOOD STYLING: MARGARET DICKEY / PROP STYLING: PHOEBE HAUSER

Step 2: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; stir in brown sugar and milk. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Remove the pot from heat; stir in peanut butter and vanilla.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Place confectioners' sugar in a large mixing bowl. Pour in peanut butter mixture and beat with an electric mixer until smooth.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Pour peanut butter mixture into an 8x8-inch dish.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Chill until firm before slicing, about 1 hour.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Fudge
Ingredients: ¼ cup unsalted butter, cut into pieces
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
FRED HARDY

Step 2: Combine chocolate chips, condensed milk, and butter in large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on medium heat until chips are melted, 3 to 5 minutes, stirring once or twice during the cooking.
FRED HARDY

Step 3: Meanwhile, generously grease an 8-inch square glass baking dish.
FRED HARDY

Step 4: Remove chocolate mixture from the microwave and stir in nuts. Pour into the prepared dish.
FRED HARDY

Step 5: Refrigerate until fudge is set, about 2 hours.
FRED HARDY

Step 6: Cut into 16 squares.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Sloppy Joe Garlic Bread
Ingredients: 2 cups prepared beef sloppy Joe mixture
1 ciabatta roll, sliced in half horizontally
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Step 2: Lay ciabatta halves, cut sides up, on the parchment paper. If the top half rocks a bit, just slice a bit off the top so that it lays flat.
Step 3: Butter cut sides, then lightly sprinkle with garlic salt. Spread sloppy Joe mixture over to cover bread to the edges. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, then mozzarella cheese.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 15 minutes. To serve as an appetizer, slice each half into 2 pieces. Sprinkle with parsley.

Name: Chicken Alfredo Garlic Bread
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, divided
1 loaf French bread, cut in half horizontally
1 (15 ounce) jar Alfredo sauce, such as Rao's®
1/2 cup grated or shredded Parmesan cheese, divided
4 cooked skinless, boneless chicken breasts, roughly chopped
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Step 2: In a small bowl whisk together 5 tablespoons melted butter, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, and 1 tablespoon parsley. Place French bread, cut sides up, on a baking sheet. Brush butter mixture evenly onto cut sides of bread.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove and set aside. Do not turn the oven off.

Step 4: Meanwhile, heat Alfredo sauce in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring often. Add remaining 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup Parmesan, remaining 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir until butter is melted and ingredients are well combined. Remove from heat.
Step 5: Spread half of Alfredo mixture evenly over toasted bread. Add chopped chicken over Alfredo, and top evenly with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, Gruyere, and Monterey Jack cheese.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is bubbly and golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
Step 7: To serve, cut into 2-inch  slices. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with remaining Alfredo sauce.

Name: Antipasti Garlic Bread
Ingredients: 1 French baguette, sliced diagonally into 3/4-inch slices
8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, cut into small cubes
1 cup cherry tomatoes, assorted colors, quartered
1 (4 ounce) package prosciutto, torn into 1/2-inch pieces
2 to 3 basil leaves, thinly sliced into ribbons
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven’s broiler to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C), and set a rack 6 inches from the heat source. Line a baking sheet with foil. Lay bread slices on the prepared sheet.

Step 2: Rub peeled garlic cloves over a microplane grater to make a paste. Add garlic paste to a bowl; sprinkle with salt. Add softened butter and mix well. Spread 1 to 2 teaspoons garlic butter on each bread slice.
Step 3: Broil garlic bread under the preheated broiler until golden, 1 to 3 minutes.

Step 4: Remove garlic bread from oven to cool slightly on a wire rack. Place mozzarella and tomatoes in a bowl; gently toss mixture, and divide evenly between bread slices. Garnish with prosciutto and basil; serve.

Name: White Gazpacho
Ingredients: 12 slices Italian bread, crusts removed, torn into small pieces
2 medium English cucumbers, peeled and chopped
1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Chives, thinly sliced green grapes, and/or thinly sliced cucumbers, for garnish
Directions: Step 1: Let bread, cashews, and water stand in a high-powered blender 5 minutes.

Step 2: Add chopped cucumbers, grapes, garlic, vinegar, and salt to blender; purée until mostly smooth, about 1 minute. With motor running, drizzle in olive oil; purée until smooth, about 30 seconds more. Chill, covered, about 1 hour. Serve soup drizzled with additional olive oil and garnished with chives, sliced grapes, and/or sliced cucumbers.

Name: Chef John's Gazpacho
Ingredients: 4 large fresh tomatoes, peeled and diced
½ English cucumber, peeled and finely diced
½ cup finely diced red bell pepper
1 large  jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
freshly ground black pepper to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
Directions:
Step 1: Combine diced tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, green onion,  jalapeño, and garlic in a large bowl. Stir in salt, cumin, oregano, cayenne pepper, and black pepper.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Place cherry tomatoes, olive oil, lime juice, balsamic vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce in a blender. Cover and purée until smooth.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Pour puréed mixture through a strainer into the tomato-cucumber mixture; stir to combine.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Place 1/3 of the tomato mixture into the blender. Cover, turn blender on, and purée until smooth. Return puréed mixture to the remaining tomato-cucumber mixture. Stir to combine. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Season cold soup with salt and black pepper to taste. Ladle into bowls and top with basil.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Easy Gazpacho
Directions: Step 1: Combine tomato juice, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, cucumber, green onions, parsley, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, garlic, tarragon, basil, sugar, salt, and pepper in a blender or food processor. Blend until well combined but still slightly chunky.
Step 2: Pour into a serving bowl and cover. Place in the refrigerator to chill before serving, at least 2 hours.

Name: Soft Gingerbread Cookies
Ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) package spice cake mix, Duncan Hines® Perfectly Moist Spice Cake Mix
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).  Line a baking sheet with parchment.
Step 2: Whisk together cake mix, ginger, and cloves. Stir egg, oil, and molasses into the cake mix mixture until combined.
Step 3: Using a cookie scoop or tablespoon, drop the dough about two inches apart onto the prepared baking sheet.

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are set, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Cook’s Note
To make soft crinkle gingerbread cookies, roll the dough into evenly sized balls and coat in a mixture of equal parts granulated sugar and powdered sugar. Bake according to the recipe.

Name: Gingerbread Snowflakes
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all the ingredients.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 2: Whisk 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons flour, cocoa powder, ground ginger, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, cloves, black pepper, and cayenne together in a large bowl until thoroughly mixed.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 3: Cream together butter and sugar in a separate bowl with an electric mixer until pale yellow and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add molasses, vanilla, and egg. Whisk mixture until well blended. Add flour mixture to butter mixture and stir just until the flour disappears.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 4: Spread out a piece of plastic wrap on the counter and set dough on top. Wrap dough with plastic wrap while shaping it into a rectangle approximately 1-inch high by 4 to 5 inches wide. Refrigerate until dough is cold and firm, about 1 hour.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a Silpat mat.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 6: After the dough has chilled, slice across the block into 14 or 15 pieces about 3/8 inch thick. Each slice is then cut in half, and each half into 3 strips lengthwise.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 7: Use 3 strips of the dough to form the 6-pointed star as shown and place onto the prepared baking sheet with space in between as they spread out.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven for about 12 minutes if you like the cookies to be chewy, or 15 minutes for crispy cookies. Remove from the oven and wait for 5 minutes before carefully transferring cookies to a wire rack. Allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 9: Mix together the powdered sugar and water until a ribbon is formed. Transfer the icing into a piping bag with a small round tip. Pipe snowflake designs onto the cooled cookies.
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Step 10: Serve and enjoy!
ALLRECIPES / BAHAREH NAITI

Name: Big Soft Ginger Cookies
Ingredients: ¾ cup butter or margarine, softened
Directions:
Step 1: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Set 2 tablespoons sugar in a small bowl; set aside.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Sift flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt into a bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Beat butter and remaining 1 cup sugar in a separate large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, then stir in molasses and water. Gradually stir the sifted ingredients into the molasses mixture until well combined.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Use floured hands to shape dough into 24 walnut-sized balls. Roll each ball in the reserved sugar until coated.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Place cookies 2 inches apart onto un-greased cookie sheets, and flatten slightly with the bottom of a glass.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, switching racks halfway through.

Step 7: Remove from the oven and allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Mom's Ginger Snaps
Ingredients: ⅓ cup white sugar for decoration
Directions:
Step 1: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
DOTDASH-MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Mix brown sugar, oil, molasses, and egg together in a large bowl.
DOTDASH-MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Combine flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and salt; stir into the molasses mixture.
DOTDASH-MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Roll dough into 1 1/4-inch balls. Roll each ball in white sugar before placing 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
DOTDASH-MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until center is firm, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks.
DOTDASH-MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Grandma's Gingersnap Cookies
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place cinnamon sugar in a bowl; set aside.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Sift flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt into a mixing bowl. Stir the mixture until blended, then sift a second time into another bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Beat butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Gradually beat in white sugar. Add egg and molasses and beat until light and fluffy.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Sift 1/3 of the flour mixture into the butter mixture; stir to thoroughly blend. Sift in the remaining flour mixture and mix together until a soft dough forms.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Pinch off small amounts of dough and roll them with your hands into 1-inch-diameter balls.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Place balls in cinnamon sugar and roll to coat, then place 2-inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until tops are rounded and slightly cracked, about 10 minutes, switching racks halfway through. Cool cookies on a wire rack.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Grandma's Gingersnaps
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 2: Cream together 1 cup sugar and margarine until smooth. Beat in egg and molasses until well blended. Combine flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, and salt; stir into molasses mixture to form a dough.
Step 3: Roll dough into 1-inch balls and roll the balls in remaining 1/2 cup sugar. Place cookies 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Name: Easy Cottage Cheese Wrap
Ingredients: 1/2 cup high protein cottage cheese, such as Good Culture®
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 380 degrees F (193 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment and spray with nonstick spray.

Step 2: Add eggs and cottage cheese to the jar of a blender; blend on high until smooth, about 30 seconds. Pour mixture onto the prepared pan in a roughly rectangular shape. Sprinkle bagel seasoning over mixture.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove immediately. Allow to cool about 5 minutes before removing wrap from parchment.

Name: BLT Egg Sliders
Ingredients: 12 extra large hard boiled eggs, peeled
3/4 teaspoon seasoned salt, such as Lawry's®
Directions: Step 1: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Break bacon slices into thirds when cool enough to handle.
Step 2: Slice eggs in half lengthwise. Place 12 egg halves on a serving plate. Set other egg halves aside.
Step 3: Spread mayonnaise on 12 egg halves. Top each with 2 pieces of bacon. Top each with 1 tomato slice and 1 folded lettuce leaf.

Step 4: Top each with a reserved egg half. Secure each "slider" with a toothpick. Sprinkle with seasoned salt and serve.
From the Editor
Here’s everything you need to know about how to boil eggs.

Name: Cottage Cheese Brownie Batter
Ingredients: 1 cup 4% milkfat small curd cottage cheese
6 tablespoons maple syrup, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Place cottage cheese, maple syrup, cocoa powder, oats, almond butter, vanilla, espresso powder, and salt into the cup of a high-speed blender. Blend until ingredients are smooth. Add almond flour to blender and blend until combined. Pulse if necessary to prevent warming the mixture.
Step 2: Pour batter into a bowl and fold in chocolate chips. Serve immediately, or cover and keep stored in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

Name: Easy Homemade Ricotta Gnocchi
Ingredients: 2 cups drained ricotta (as dry as you can get it)
1 cup flour (00 and semolina blend is preferred)
salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Add drained ricotta to a food processor and process until smooth. Add eggs and pulse a few times to incorporate. Add in flour, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper, and pulse a few times just until dough comes together.

Step 2: Turn out dough onto a flour-dusted surface. Knead slightly to form a ball. Divide ball into four sections. Roll out each section into a rope of preferred size, about 1/2-inch thick. Cut rope into about 1-inch pieces with a knife or pastry cutter. Place dumplings onto a parchment-lined or floured baking sheet in a single layer.

Step 3: Place the baking sheet into the freezer for at least 20 to 30 minutes so gnocchi can freeze individually without sticking together. Move gnocchi dumplings into a freezer-safe resealable plastic bag or container to store. Freeze for at least 24 hours (and up to 2 months) before cooking.

Step 4: When ready to prepare, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add in frozen gnocchi (right from the freezer) and cook for 3 to 3 1/2 minutes, in batches if needed so as not to crowd the pot.
Step 5: Place gnocchi on a platter and serve with your sauce of choice.

Name: Alfredo Gnocchi Bake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spray an 8x8-inch baking pan with nonstick spray.
Step 2: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook and stir until fragrant, about 40 seconds. Stir in evaporated milk and cream. Add Parmesan and stir until smooth.
Step 3: Add gnocchi;  toss to coat. Pour gnocchi into the prepared pan. Sprinkle with black pepper.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 25 minutes. Serve hot.

Name: Gnocchi Mac and Cheese
Ingredients: 1 cup evaporated milk or half-and-half, or more as needed
1 cup shredded sharp extra-sharp Cheddar cheese
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Step 2: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium high-heat. Whisk in flour until smooth, and cook about 1 minute.

Step 3: Whisk in cream, evaporated milk, Worcestershire, and mustard. Stir in Cheddar cheese and cheese powder and cook until cheese melts, about 2 minutes. If you prefer a thinner sauce, add evaporated milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until sauce is the consistency you like.
Step 4: Stir in gnocchi; pour mixture into a small baking dish.
Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Name: Classic Goulash
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon seasoned salt, or to taste
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
STACY ALLEN / FOOD STYLIST: JULIAN HENSERLING / PROP STYLIST: CHRISTINA DALEY

Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook 3 minutes, stirring often.
STACY ALLEN / FOOD STYLIST: JULIAN HENSERLING / PROP STYLIST: CHRISTINA DALEY

Step 3: Add ground beef and cook, breaking up the meat until it is evenly browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 3 minutes, stirring often.
STACY ALLEN / FOOD STYLIST: JULIAN HENSERLING / PROP STYLIST: CHRISTINA DALEY

Step 4: Stir in water, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, soy sauce, Italian seasoning, seasoned salt, and bay leaves. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook 5 minutes, stirring halfway through.
STACY ALLEN / FOOD STYLIST: JULIAN HENSERLING / PROP STYLIST: CHRISTINA DALEY

Step 5: Stir in uncooked macaroni, cover, and simmer over medium heat until pasta is tender, 11 to 13 minutes, stirring occasionally.
STACY ALLEN / FOOD STYLIST: JULIAN HENSERLING / PROP STYLIST: CHRISTINA DALEY

Step 6: Remove from heat, discard bay leaves, and serve.
STACY ALLEN / FOOD STYLIST: JULIAN HENSERLING / PROP STYLIST: CHRISTINA DALEY

Name: Hungarian Goulash
Ingredients: 3 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1 1/2 inch cubes
Directions: Step 1: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook and stir onions in oil until soft, 2 to 4 minutes. Remove onions and set them aside.
Step 2: Combine paprika, 2 teaspoons salt, and pepper in a medium bowl. Coat beef cubes in spice mixture, and cook in the onion pot until brown on all sides.

Step 3: Return onions to the pot with beef; pour in water, tomato paste, garlic, and remaining 1 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until meat is tender, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Chef John's American Goulash
Ingredients: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and onion; cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly and onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Continue to cook and stir until liquid is evaporated, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic, bay leaves, paprika, Italian seasoning, salt, black pepper, and cayenne.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Cook, stirring occasionally, until flavors come together, about 3 minutes. Pour in broth, marinara sauce, and diced tomatoes. Pour water into the sauce jar, swirl, and pour into the pot. Stir in soy sauce; bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until flavors intensify, about 30 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a rapid simmer. Stir in macaroni; cook, stirring occasionally, until just barely tender, about 12 minutes. Check for doneness after 10 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 5: Remove from the heat and discard bay leaves. Stir in Cheddar and parsley. Cover and let rest for 5 minutes. Taste and season as desired.

Name: Granola Cups
Ingredients: nonstick baking spray with flour (such as Baker's Joy®)
1 cup plain whole milk Greek yogurt, or as needed
1 cup fresh berries, or as needed
Directions: Step 1: Place butter and maple syrup in a large bowl and place into the microwave. Heat in 30 second intervals, stirring after every 30 seconds, until butter is melted, about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes. Remove bowl from microwave and add in vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg. Stir until thoroughly combined. Add in oats, almonds, coconut, and flax meal. Stir until mixture is thoroughly combined.
Step 2: Generously grease a standard muffin tin with nonstick baking spray with flour.

Step 3: Divide oat mixture evenly between the muffin cups, about 2 heaped tablespoons per cup. With wet hands, press mixture into the bottom and up the sides of each cup. Place the pan into the fridge to chill for 15 minutes.
Step 4: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 5: Bake chilled granola cups in the preheated oven until the outside edges of cups turn golden brown,  25 to 30 minutes. Remove cups from the oven; cool to room temperature in the pan, about 30 minutes.
Step 6: Use an offset spatula or butter knife to pop them out of the pan. To serve, fill each granola cup with yogurt and top with berries. Serve immediately.

Name: Yogurt Parfait
Directions: Step 1: Layer 1 cup yogurt, 1/2 cup granola, and 4 blackberries in a large glass; repeat layers.

Name: Megan's Granola
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
Step 2: Combine oats, wheat germ, oat bran, sunflower seeds, almonds, pecans, and walnuts in a large bowl.

Step 3: Stir oil, honey, brown sugar, maple syrup, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt together in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, then pour over dry ingredients and stir to coat. Transfer to the prepared baking sheets and spread out evenly.

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until crispy and toasted, about 20 minutes, stirring once halfway through. Let cool for 15 to 20 minutes, then stir in raisins.
REEM MUZAHEM

Name: Beef au Jus
Ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Melt drippings in a skillet over medium-high heat. Whisk in flour and cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture thickens, about 3 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add beef broth gradually, whisking constantly, then increase heat to high and bring to a boil.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Roast Beef and Pan Gravy for Beginners
Ingredients: 3 1/2 to 4 teaspoons kosher salt (use 1 teaspoon per pound of beef)
3 1/2 to 4 pounds top round beef roast (sometimes sold as "London Broil")
3 cups torn miatake (hen-of-the-woods) mushrooms, or any mushrooms
2 tablespoons sherry vinegar or any wine vinegar
2 cups high quality, low-sodium beef broth
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Combine 1 teaspoon salt per pound of beef, 1 teaspoon black pepper, and granulated garlic in a small bowl and mix well. Set the beef on a piece of butcher paper, and apply half of salt mixture evenly to each side, tamping it on lightly with a fork. Press the sides of the roast onto any seasoning that has fallen onto the paper. Place beef on a wire rack set over a pan. Refrigerate the “dry brined” beef, uncovered, for 24 hours, turning meat over once after 12 hours.
Step 2: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).

Step 3: Heat oil in an oven-safe pan or skillet over high heat; add beef to pan and sear on both sides until nicely browned, about 3 minutes per side. Using tongs, pick up the meat and sear on the sides as well, if desired.

Step 4: Turn off heat and add onions to the pan wherever they fit; top with mushrooms. Season vegetables with the 1/2 teaspoon salt. Drizzle melted butter over vegetables, and brush melted butter over beef.
Step 5: Roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.

Step 6: Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees F (170 degrees C), and continue to roast beef until desired internal temperature is reached. Begin to check temperature after 15 to 20 minutes. For medium-rare, an instant-read thermometer inserted near the center of beef should reach 125 degrees F (52 degrees C). For medium, internal temperature should reach 130 to 135 degrees F (54 to 57 degrees C). Total roasting time will depend on the size of the roast.
Step 7: Remove beef from the oven, transfer to a plate, and cover loosely with foil. Let rest at least 15 to 20 minutes before slicing.
Step 8: Meanwhile, prepare the gravy. Remove mushrooms from the pan, and keep warm until ready to serve.

Step 9: Melt 1 tablespoon cold butter in the pan over medium-high heat; sprinkle in flour, and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Whisk in vinegar and beef broth, and bring mixture to a boil, stirring occasionally. Season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne to taste, and add thyme leaves.
Step 10: Continue boiling on medium-high heat until gravy reduces by about half and thickens slightly. Gravy can be reduced more for a thicker texture.

Step 11: Once meat is rested, slice thinly at a 45-degree angle, and serve with mushrooms and hot gravy over the top.
CHEF JOHN
Chef's Notes:
This method will work with any type of beef roast, but times will vary.
A splash of red wine (about 1/4 cup) can be used instead of vinegar.
For a thicker gravy, double the butter and flour amounts for the beginning gravy step.

Name: Simple Turkey Gravy
Ingredients: ½ cup fat from turkey drippings
Directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
Step 2: Heat fat from turkey drippings in a saucepan over medium-low heat until liquefied, 2 to 3 minutes. Whisk flour into turkey fat until golden, about 5 minutes.

Step 3: Whisk liquid from turkey drippings and turkey stock into fat-flour mixture; increase heat to medium and cook, whisking continuously, until gravy is smooth and desired consistency, 5 to 10 minutes. Season gravy with pepper.

Name: Mixed Salad
Ingredients: 3 mini cucumbers, sliced on the diagonal
Directions: Step 1: In a food processor, add vinegar, garlic clove, and Italian seasoning. Add lid. Turn to purée and slowly stream in olive oil. Adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper and sugar to taste.
Step 2: Add lettuce, spinach, arugula, cucumbers, carrots, tomatoes, and red onion to a large bowl. Toss to combine.
Step 3: Dress salad greens with vinaigrette and add shaved Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Name: Roasted Tomato Balsamic Vinaigrette
Ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Whisk tomato paste, balsamic vinegar, rice vinegar, and Dijon mustard together in a bowl until smooth.

Step 2: Slowly drizzle olive oil into tomato paste mixture while whisking rapidly until dressing is thick and creamy. Season with salt and black pepper.
KIM'S COOKING NOW

Name: Warm Broccoli Caesar Salad
Ingredients: 1 1/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, divided
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE
Step 2: Spread out broccoli on a large rimmed baking sheet. Toss with 2 tablespoons of the canola oil, 3/4 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper until evenly coated.

Step 3: Roast in the preheated oven until broccoli is bright green and browned in spots, 18 to 20 minutes.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 4: Meanwhile, combine 1/2 cup oil, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, eggs, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, Dijon mustard, 3/4 teaspoon black pepper, and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a blender; process until smooth, about 2 minutes. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 5: Add bacon to a large skillet over medium heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until crispy, about 10 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon fat in skillet and do not wipe clean; discard remaining drippings.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 6: Add panko and remaining 1/4 teaspoon black pepper to skillet over low heat; cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Step 7: Transfer broccoli to a large serving bowl. Top with panko, bacon, and remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan. Drizzle with desired amount of Caesar dressing. Refrigerate remaining Caesar dressing for up to 4 days.
ROBBY LOZANO / FOOD STYLING: AMANDA STANFIELD / PROP STYLING: KEOSHIA MCGHEE

Name: Southern Grits Casserole
Ingredients: ½ cup butter, cut into pieces, divided
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a large baking dish.

Step 2: Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan; stir in grits. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until liquid has been absorbed, about 5 minutes. Mix in 2 cups Cheddar cheese and 1/2 of the butter until melted.
Step 3: Cook sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and add to grits mixture.
Step 4: Whisk eggs and milk together in a bowl. Pour into the skillet used to cook the sausage. Lightly scramble eggs over medium-low heat, then mix into grits mixture.
Step 5: Pour grits mixture into the prepared baking dish. Dot with remaining butter, sprinkle with remaining 1 cup Cheddar, and season with salt and pepper.

Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 30 minutes.
MELISSA GOFF

Name: Breakfast Grits
Ingredients: ½ cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
BRIE GOLDMAN / FOOD STYLIST: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLIST: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 2: Bring water and salt to a boil in a saucepan. Whisk in grits; continue to whisk for 1 minute.
BRIE GOLDMAN / FOOD STYLIST: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLIST: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 3: When the mixture comes to a boil again, turn the heat to low. Stir frequently, cook for 10 to 15 minutes.
BRIE GOLDMAN / FOOD STYLIST: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLIST: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 4: Remove grits from the heat and add cheese, butter, and pepper; mix well.
BRIE GOLDMAN / FOOD STYLIST: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLIST: GABRIEL GRECO

Step 5: Stir until butter and cheese are melted.
BRIE GOLDMAN / FOOD STYLIST: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLIST: GABRIEL GRECO

Name: Cheese Grits Casserole
Ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package processed cheese (such as Velveeta®), cubed
½ pound sharp Cheddar cheese, cubed
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x12-inch baking dish.
Step 2: Bring milk, water, and salt to a boil in a large saucepan; gradually sprinkle grits into the boiling liquid, stirring to combine. Cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.

Step 3: Stir processed cheese, sharp Cheddar cheese, butter, and garlic powder into grits, stirring until cheese has melted. Let the mixture stand until cooled, about 15 minutes. Stir beaten eggs into grits; transfer to prepared baking dish.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until the top is lightly golden brown and the grits are set, about 45 minutes.

Name: Instant Pot® Ground Beef and Pasta
Directions: Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function. Brown beef in the hot pot with Italian seasoning and salt, 5 to 7 minutes. Add onion and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in pasta, both cans of tomato sauce, and beef broth. Close and lock the lid.
Step 2: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 6 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Step 3: Let sit with the lid closed for 5 minutes. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.
Step 4: Stir in Cheddar cheese until melted. Stir in baby spinach until wilted. Stir in heavy cream. Serve immediately.

Name: This One-Pan Cheeseburger Rice Is the Perfect All-in-One Dinner
Ingredients: 1 pound ground turkey or ground beef
3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to Low Broil.

Step 2: Heat oil in a large, deep oven–proof skillet over medium-high heat.  Add onion and cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Add ground turkey and cook, crumbling with a spoon until lightly browned, about 7 minutes.

Step 3: Season with salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, garlic powder, 3 tablespoons ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce and stir to combine. Add broth and water and bring to a boil, stirring often to loosen any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.

Step 4: Stir in rice and return to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Add up to 1/4 cup additional water if needed if liquid is evaporated before rice is tender.
Step 5: Just before it is finished, stir in 1 1/4 cups of cheese to rice mixture and top with remaining cheese.
Step 6: Broil in the preheated oven just until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 3 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Step 7: Meanwhile, for burger sauce, add remaining pepper and remaining ketchup with mayonnaise and mustard in a small bowl. Stir until well combined and set aside. Serve topped with pickles, lettuce, and burger sauce.

Name: Slow Cooker Shepherd’s Pie
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 2: Cook ground beef and onion in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is tender; about 8 minutes. Add garlic. Cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute; drain fat.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 3: Add beef mixture and frozen mixed vegetables to a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 4: Whisk together beef broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, tapioca, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Pour over beef mixture; stir to combine.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 5: Cover and cook on Low for 4 to 6 hours or on High for 3 hours.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 6: Prepare mashed potatoes according to package directions. Stir in cheese. Spread atop the beef mixture. 
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 7: Cover and cook on High for 20 minutes.
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Step 8: Garnish with paprika and parsley
JAKE STERNQUIST / FOOD STYLING: LAUREN MCANELLY / PROP STYLING: SUE MITCHELL

Name: Chicken Florentine Meatballs
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI
Step 2: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a 10x15-inch baking sheet with parchment paper.

Step 3: For meatballs, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic until tender, about 3 minutes. Add chopped spinach and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes. Set aside to cool. 
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Step 4: Combine ground chicken, panko, cornstarch, Italian seasoning, salt, and crushed red pepper in a large bowl. Gently stir in cooled onion mixture. 
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Step 5: Shape mixture into about 20 meatballs using about 1 1/2 tablespoons per meatball. Place on prepared baking sheet.
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Step 6: Bake until an instant read thermometer inserted in the center of meatballs reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), 20 to 25 minutes. 
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Step 7: Meanwhile for sauce, heat butter in the same skillet. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add flour and cook 1 additional minute. Add wine and chicken broth. Simmer and stir until thickened and bubbly, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in cream and Parmesan cheese. Cook until slightly thickened, 2 minutes. Add spinach and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Step 8: Add meatballs to skillet, stir to coat in sauce. Return to a simmer, about 1 minute.
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Step 9: Serve warm.
JASON DONNELLY / FOOD STYLING: HOLLY DREESMAN / PROP STYLING: NATALIE GHAZALI

Name: Slow Cooker Chicken Apple Butter Meatballs
Ingredients: 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more to taste
1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme, plus more for garnish
1 1/2 cups apple butter (such as White House®)
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
Step 2: Peel apple; discard peels. Grate apple on the largest holes of a box grater to yield 2/3 cup. Place grated apple in a large bowl.

Step 3: Add chicken, panko, egg, salt, thyme, poultry seasoning, and black pepper to bowl with grated apples. Mix until just combined. Shape into 18 balls (about 2 tablespoons each).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Stir together apple butter, chicken stock, Worcestershire, and chicken bouillon in a 6-quart slow cooker bowl. Place meatballs in sauce mixture.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Cover and cook until meatballs are cooked through and sauce thickens enough to coat the meatballs, about 2 hours on HIGH or 4 hours on LOW, stirring halfway through. Stir in butter until melted and season with additional salt to taste.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Transfer meatballs and sauce to a platter; insert each meatball with a toothpick and garnish with chopped thyme.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Chicken Cordon Bleu Meatballs
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley, plus more for garnish
1/2 cup finely chopped deli ham (about 3 ounces)
2 ounces Swiss cheese, cut into 12 cubes
Directions: Step 1: Combine shallot, half and half, parsley, egg, and 1/3 cup Italian breadcrumbs in a mixing bowl and stir together.
Step 2: Add ham and chicken; season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika. Mix all ingredients together just until uniform.

Step 3: Add remaining Italian bread crumbs and panko to a shallow dish and stir to combine. Roll meat mixture into 12 balls and stuff a Swiss cheese cube into the center. Roll each ball in breadcrumbs until evenly coated; place on a plate or baking sheet. Freeze meatballs for 10 minutes.
Step 4: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and set a wire rack inside a rimmed baking sheet.
Step 5: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add meatballs and cook until browned on all sides, 5 to 10 minutes. Transfer meatballs to the prepared wire rack.
Step 6: Bake meatballs in the preheated oven until an instant read thermometer, inserted near the center, reads 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 10 minutes.

Step 7: Meanwhile, make sauce. Wipe skillet clean and melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook 1 minute. Whisk in broth and half-and-half. Stir in mustard, salt, and pepper and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and simmer until sauce is rich and creamy, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice.

Step 8: Serve meatballs with Dijon cream sauce.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Spiced Harissa Beef-and-Lamb Koftas
Directions: Step 1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat (350 to 375 degrees F (175 to 190 degrees C)).

Step 2: Combine beef, lamb, egg, cilantro, onion, harissa, garlic, coriander, 1 teaspoon salt, the cumin, turmeric, ginger, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Be careful not to overmix, or meat will be tough. Shape mixture around 6 (10-inch) skewers, making the meat mixture 1-inch thick around the skewers.
Step 3: Oil grill grates. Grill koftas, covered, turning occasionally, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into centers registers 160 degrees F (71 degrees C), about 15 minutes.

Step 4: Meanwhile, stir yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, parsley, and 1/8 teaspoon salt together in a small bowl. Serve yogurt sauce with koftas.
Cook’s Note
Harissa is available as a sauce or as a paste, which have distinct consistencies. Brands also differ by ingredients and heat level, so start with a small amount and taste before adding more.
If using wooden skewers, soak 30 minutes before using to prevent burning.

Name: Sophie's Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: 4 large baking potatoes, peeled and cubed
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Step 2: Place the potatoes into a saucepan and fill with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, then cook over medium heat until tender enough to pierce with a fork, about 10 minutes. Drain and mash with butter and milk to your desired texture.

Step 3: Meanwhile, crumble the ground lamb into a large skillet. Cook and stir until no longer pink. Season with Worcestershire sauce and beef bouillon. Add the mushrooms and onion; continue to cook and stir until tender. Transfer the contents of the skillet to a large casserole dish.

Step 4: Mix the baked beans, diced tomatoes, gravy mix and carrots in with the lamb. Dollop big blobs of mashed potatoes over the top and carefully spread evenly to cover the entire top. Rake over it with a fork to create a crispy texture on top when it browns.
Step 5: Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until the top is browned and crisp.

Name: Turkish Doner Kebab
Ingredients: ½ teaspoon dried Italian herb seasoning
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 2: Combine flour, oregano, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, Italian seasoning, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a large bowl. Add ground lamb and knead until thoroughly mixed together, about 3 minutes.
Step 3: Shape seasoned lamb mixture and place into a loaf pan; set on top of a baking sheet.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven, turning halfway to ensure even browning, for about 1 hour and 20 minutes.
Step 5: Wrap loaf in aluminum foil and let rest for about 10 minutes. Slice as thinly as possible to make doner kebab pieces.

Name: Apple Butter Meatballs
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Step 2: Combine ground beef, ground pork, panko, onion, milk, egg, salt, granulated garlic, and pepper in a large bowl. If mixture is too soft or wet, place in the refrigerator for 15 to 20 minutes to firm up before rolling. Shape into 24 meatballs, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter, and place on the prepared baking sheet.

Step 3: Bake meatballs in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the center and browned on the outside, about 20 minutes. An instant read thermometer inserted into the center of meatballs should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

Step 4: Meanwhile, prepare apple butter bourbon glaze. In a small saucepan, whisk together apple butter, bourbon, soy sauce, maple syrup, and Dijon mustard. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat and stir frequently until the sauce is smooth and just thickened, 5 to 7 minutes.
Step 5: Remove meatballs from the oven and transfer to a large bowl. Pour glaze over meatballs and gently toss to coat evenly. Serve warm.

Name: Giant Lazy Meatballs
Ingredients: 4 large slices stale white bread, crusts removed
Directions: Step 1: Crumble bread into a bowl and mix in milk thoroughly using a fork. Let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.

Step 2: Combine beef and pork in a large bowl and mix well using 2 forks. Add salt, black pepper, oregano, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne, olive oil, Parmesan, parsley, eggs, and the breadcrumb mixture. Mix using 2 forks until everything is evenly combined. Wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Step 3: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a roasting pan or baking dish. Using damp hands, roll 4 giant meatballs, and place in the prepared pan.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until an instant read thermometer inserted near the center of meatballs reads 160 to 165 degrees F (71 to 74 degrees C), 40 to 45 minutes.
Step 5: Remove meatballs from the oven, and spoon tomato sauce evenly over meatballs. Sprinkle first with Monterey Jack cheese, and then with Parmigiano-Reggiano.

Step 6: Return meatballs to the oven, and bake until sauce is hot and cheese is melted, 5 to 10 minutes more. Top with parsley and serve.
JOHN MITZEWICH

Name: Ground Pork Tacos with Pineapple Salsa
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon soy-based liquid seasoning (such as Maggi® Jugo)
1 small jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced
Directions: Step 1: Combine ground pork, liquid seasoning, ground chipotle powder, and garlic in a bowl. Set aside briefly for flavors to meld.
Step 2: Meanwhile, make the salsa: Combine pineapple, red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, lime juice, and salt in a bowl. Set aside.

Step 3: Preheat a large skillet over high heat. Crumble ground pork into the hot skillet. Cook and stir until pork is completely browned and edges begin to crisp, 7 to 10 minutes. Drain any excess grease. Place pork in a bowl and keep warm. Wipe out skillet.
Step 4: Warm tortillas in skillet over medium-low heat, about 20 seconds per side. Divide meat mixture between tortillas and top with pineapple salsa.

Name: This One-Pan Cheeseburger Rice Is the Perfect All-in-One Dinner
Ingredients: 1 pound ground turkey or ground beef
3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to Low Broil.
