Step 4: Arrange the trifle just before serving to ensure the chocolate stays loose. In a trifle bowl or medium serving bowl, add half of melted chocolate. Top with half of strawberries, half of raspberries, half of blueberries, and half of blackberries.

Step 5: Top with half of pistachio cream mixture. Sprinkle with 3/4 cup toasted kataifi. Add remaining berries and remaining pistachio cream, and top with remaining chocolate. Sprinkle over remaining kataifi and serve immediately.

Name: Lobster Stuffed Pasta Shells For Two
Ingredients: 2 small lobster tails, 3 to 4 ounces each
Directions: Step 1: This step is optional, but greatly improves the flavor and look of the final dish: Wilt spinach in a dry pan over medium-high heat, transfer into a strainer. Let cool, then squeeze out excess water, and chop with a knife. Refrigerate until needed.

Step 2: Cut lengthwise with scissors along the center of each lobster shell on both top and bottom, and remove meat. Set shells aside for sauce. Open up lobster tail meat down the center, slicing open with a knife if necessary, and devein if needed. Rinse briefly under cold water to remove any grit.

Step 3: Chop meat with a knife into small pieces, about 1/4-inch in size. Transfer into a mixing bowl; add chopped spinach, ricotta, mozzarella, lemon zest, garlic, salt, cayenne, and smoked paprika. Mix thoroughly; refrigerate until needed.

Step 4: Cut reserved lobster shells with scissors into 1-inch pieces. Melt butter over medium-high heat in a saucepan, and add lobster shells. Cook, stirring, until lobster shells turn a deep red-orange color and smell like cooked lobster, 1 to 2 minutes.

Step 5: Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds more. Pour in cream; rinse measuring cup with a small splash of water and add to the saucepan. Season with salt and cayenne. Bring to a boil, adjust temperature to prevent boiling over, and cook until cream reduces and thickens slightly, enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 4 minutes.
Step 6: Pour lobster cream through a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl, allowing all liquid to drain through. Set cream sauce aside until needed; discard shells.

Step 7: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add shells and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes less than package directions. Transfer shells into a bowl of cold water to cool immediately, then drain well.
Step 8: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Step 9: Use a spoon to generously stuff 8 cooked pasta shells with lobster filling.

Step 10: Spoon about three quarters of lobster cream sauce into a (1-quart) baking dish. A cake pan or deep pie dish can also be used. Arrange stuffed shells in the dish, evenly spaced not more than about 1/2 inch apart.

Step 11: Top each shell with a small amount of mozzarella. Drizzle a few teaspoons of remaining lobster cream sauce over top of each shell. Any extra sauce can be added to the baking dish if desired, or reserved to reheat and serve with cooked shells.
Step 12: Grate a small amount of Parmesan over the top, and drizzle with olive oil if desired.
Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and hot throughout, and golden brown on top, 25 to 30 minutes.
Step 14: Let rest at least 5 minutes before serving.

Name: Coconut Milk Ice Cream
Directions: Step 1: Whisk together coconut milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt in a small bowl until sugar dissolves. Chill until cold, at least 2 hours. Churn in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer’s directions. Freeze in an airtight container at least 4 hours or up to 3 months.

Name: Marry Me Chickpeas
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon grapeseed oil or olive oil, or more as needed
1 teaspoon smoked paprika, or more to taste
1/3 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes in oil
Directions: Step 1: Heat oil in a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and garlic. Cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.
Step 2: Add paprika, oregano, salt,  and pepper flakes, and cook and stir to toast spices, about 1 minute. Add tomato paste, sundried tomatoes, and chickpeas, and stir well to fully coat chickpeas.
Step 3: Add vegetable broth and lemon juice, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add a little more broth if mixture seems too thick. Add coconut milk, stir well, and remove from heat.

Name: Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes
Ingredients: 3 1/4 to 3 1/2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and quartered
2 tablespoons salt for boiling water, plus more to taste
Directions: Step 1: Add peeled and quartered potatoes to a sauce pan. Cover with cold water by at least 1 inch. Season with salt and garlic, and bring to a boil on medium-high heat.
Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer gently until potatoes are very soft, about 25 minutes. Drain potatoes and add back into the pot or into a bowl.
Step 3: Use a potato masher to mash potatoes until very smooth. Switch to a whisk or electric hand mixer, and whip in the olive oil in two additions.

Step 4: Season to taste with salt; serve with more olive oil drizzled over the top if desired.
JOHN MITZEWICH
Chef's Notes:
A mild, buttery olive oil is the best choice for this recipe, rather than one with a peppery, grassy flavor.
You can use Yukon gold potatoes, but the texture will not be as light and fluffy.
For more intense garlic flavor, garlic can be finely crushed and added raw to the potatoes when olive oil is added.

Name: Miso Roasted Broccoli
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

Step 2: In a large bowl whisk butter, soy sauce, vinegar, miso paste, and garlic until smooth. Add broccoli florets and toss until evenly combined. Spread broccoli mixture on the prepared baking sheet in an even layer.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until tender, about 15 minutes.

Name: Ginger Sesame Cabbage
Ingredients: 4 cloves garlic, peeled and green germ removed
1/8 teaspoon flavor enhancer, such as Acc'ent®
1 pound cabbage, cut into bite-sized pieces or sliced into thin threads
chopped green onion and cilantro leaves for garnish
Directions: Step 1: Place garlic, sesame oil, sesame seeds, rice wine vinegar, bouillon powder, brown sugar, lemon juice, ginger paste, and Ac'cent in a mortar and mash with a pestle until the paste is smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Step 2: Place cabbage in a bowl; pour dressing over and stir until well coated. Serve with cilantro and green onion on top.

Name: Roasted Cauliflower with Alfredo Sauce
Ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the air fryer to 380 degrees F (193 degrees C). Add cauliflower florets to a small bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Air fry until cauliflower is tender with a bite, 8 to 10 minutes.

Step 3: For Alfredo sauce, add milk, cottage cheese, garlic powder, and Parmesan cheese into a blender. Blend on high until smooth. Transfer mixture into a saucepan; heat on low until warmed. Drizzle over cauliflower florets.

Name: Sloppy Joe Garlic Bread
Ingredients: 2 cups prepared beef sloppy Joe mixture
1 ciabatta roll, sliced in half horizontally
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Step 2: Lay ciabatta halves, cut sides up, on the parchment paper. If the top half rocks a bit, just slice a bit off the top so that it lays flat.
Step 3: Butter cut sides, then lightly sprinkle with garlic salt. Spread sloppy Joe mixture over to cover bread to the edges. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, then mozzarella cheese.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 15 minutes. To serve as an appetizer, slice each half into 2 pieces. Sprinkle with parsley.

Name: Olive Cheese Bread
Ingredients: 1 cup drained sliced pimento-stuffed green olives
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment.
Step 2: Scoop out just a little from the cut side of each bread slice to make a shallow well, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Step 3: Combine mayonnaise, butter, Thai chili sauce, and Sriracha in a bowl. Fold in cheese, olives, and green onions until well combined. Evenly spread olive mixture on cut sides of bread.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and starting to brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
Step 5: Set aside for 5 minutes to allow the cheese to firm up slightly; sprinkle with parsley. Slice each bread half into 2-inch portions, and serve warm or at room temperature.

Name: White Bean and Tomato Pasta
Ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil over high heat. Cook pasta in boiling water until cooked through but still firm to bite, about 10 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Step 2: Meanwhile, puree cannellini beans, garlic, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a food processor until smooth. Set aside.
Step 3: Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, red pepper flakes, and cherry tomatoes to a skillet. Cook over medium heat until tomatoes are warmed, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Step 4: Stir pureed bean sauce into the skillet; stir in Parmesan cheese and pasta. Season with salt and pepper, and serve warm.

Name: White Bean and Tomato Pasta
Ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil over high heat. Cook pasta in boiling water until cooked through but still firm to bite, about 10 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Step 2: Meanwhile, puree cannellini beans, garlic, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a food processor until smooth. Set aside.
Step 3: Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, red pepper flakes, and cherry tomatoes to a skillet. Cook over medium heat until tomatoes are warmed, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Step 4: Stir pureed bean sauce into the skillet; stir in Parmesan cheese and pasta. Season with salt and pepper, and serve warm.

Name: Cheesy Lasagna Sheet Pasta
Ingredients: 8 ounces lasagna noodles, broken in half
8 ounces shredded whole milk mozzarella cheese
Directions: Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasanga noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes.
Step 2: Strain noodles and return to the pot. Add tomato sauce and cook on medium heat until sauce is heated through, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add cheese and stir until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Name: Marry Me Chickpeas
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon grapeseed oil or olive oil, or more as needed
1 teaspoon smoked paprika, or more to taste
1/3 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes in oil
Directions: Step 1: Heat oil in a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and garlic. Cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.
Step 2: Add paprika, oregano, salt,  and pepper flakes, and cook and stir to toast spices, about 1 minute. Add tomato paste, sundried tomatoes, and chickpeas, and stir well to fully coat chickpeas.
Step 3: Add vegetable broth and lemon juice, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add a little more broth if mixture seems too thick. Add coconut milk, stir well, and remove from heat.

Name: TikTok Croiffles
Directions: Step 1: Preheat your waffle iron to medium-low heat, then spritz with cooking spray.

Step 2: If desired, roll the thawed dough in sugar before cooking (it should stick with ease). Place the thawed dough on the waffle iron, close the lid, and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, or until golden brown.
Step 3: Preheat your waffle iron to medium-low heat, then spritz with cooking spray.

Step 4: On a lightly-floured surface, roll out the crescent roll dough with a rolling pin until it reaches an even thinness, being careful not to incorporate too much flour. Cut along the perforated lines. Place 1-2 tablespoons of your desired filling on the wide end of the dough and, starting on the wide end, roll the dough into a croissant shape.
Step 5: Move the rolled dough to the waffle iron, close the lid, and cook for 1 ½ to 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
Step 6: Preheat your waffle iron to medium-low heat, then spritz with cooking spray.

Step 7: On a lightly-floured surface, roll out the sheet of puff pastry dough with a rolling pin until you get a large rectangle with even thinness. Be careful not to incorporate too much flour. Using a knife or pizza cutter, cut out 8 long and thin triangles.
Step 8: Place 1-2 tablespoons of your desired filling on the wide end of the triangle and, starting on the wide end, roll the dough into a croissant shape.
Step 9: Move the rolled dough to the waffle iron, close the lid, and cook for 4-6 minutes, or until golden brown.

Name: Waffle House-Style Waffles
Ingredients: ¼ cup salted butter, softened, plus more for serving
pure maple syrup, and/or chocolate chips, for serving
Directions: Step 1: Whisk together flour, cornstarch, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a bowl.

Step 2: Whisk together egg, sugar, butter, and vanilla in a separate large bowl until mixture is smooth. Whisk in half-and-half and buttermilk. Add flour mixture; stir until just combined and a few lumps remain. (Do not overmix.) Chill, covered, at least 1 hour or up to overnight.

Step 3: Preheat waffle iron to medium-high; lightly coat with cooking spray. Pour about 2/3 cup batter onto waffle iron. Cook until golden and crisp on edges, 4 to 6 minutes. Transfer to a plate; keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter.
Step 4: Serve waffles with maple syrup, chocolate chips, and/or additional butter.

Name: Waffles
Directions: Step 1: Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.

Step 2: Whisk eggs in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add flour, milk, and vegetable oil and mix to combine. Whisk in sugar, then mix in baking powder, salt, and vanilla just until smooth, being careful not to overmix.

Step 3: Spray the preheated waffle iron with nonstick spray. Pour batter onto the hot waffle iron and cook until golden brown and the iron stops steaming, 3 to 5 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIO

Name: Waldorf Salad
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Whisk mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, and salt together in a serving bowl.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Stir in apples, celery, walnuts, and raisins. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Simply The Best Chicken Waldorf Salad
Ingredients: ½ Granny Smith apple, cored and cubed
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Step 2: Spread chopped walnuts onto a baking sheet.
Step 3: Roast walnuts in the preheated oven until they are fragrant and browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove and let cool.

Step 4: Lightly toss chicken with grape halves, cranberries, apple, walnuts, and onion in a salad bowl. Whisk mayonnaise, vanilla yogurt, and lemon juice in a separate bowl. Pour dressing over salad and toss again to coat.

Name: Simple Waldorf Salad
Directions: Step 1: Whisk together mayonnaise and vinegar in a mixing bowl.
Step 2: Add apples, celery, raisins, and walnuts to the bowl. Season with salt and pepper; mix well.
Step 3: Place in the refrigerator until chilled, about 30 minutes.

Name: Simple Whole Wheat Bread
Ingredients: 3 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
4 cups whole wheat flour, or more as needed
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Mix warm water, yeast, and 1/3 cup honey in a large bowl to dissolve.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Add 5 cups bread flour, and stir to combine.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Let sit for 30 minutes, or until big and bubbly.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Mix in 3 tablespoons melted butter, remaining 1/3 cup honey, and salt. Stir in 2 cups whole wheat flour.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Transfer dough to a floured work surface and gradually knead in remaining 2 cups whole wheat flour.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 7: Knead until dough starts to pull away from the work surface, adding more whole wheat flour if necessary; dough should be a bit tacky to the touch, but not too sticky.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Place in a greased bowl, turning once to coat the surface of the dough.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 9: Cover with a dish towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 10: Grease three 9x5-inch loaf pans. Punch down the dough, and divide it into 3 loaves.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 11: Place in the prepared loaf pans, and allow to rise until dough has topped the pans by one inch, another 45 minutes to 1 hour.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 12: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake the risen loaves in the preheated oven until golden brown for 25 to 30 minutes, do not overbake.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 13: Lightly brush the tops of the loaves with remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter when done to prevent crust from getting hard.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 14: Cool completely. Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Quick Whole Wheat Chapati
Directions: Step 1: Mix flour and salt together in a bowl. Stir in water to form a soft dough.
Step 2: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead several times. Divide into 8 pieces and roll each into a ball. Roll each ball into a very thin round using a rolling pin.
Step 3: Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Cook each dough round on griddle until dough bubbles and blisters appear, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side.

Name: Guinness Bread
Ingredients: 1 cup regular rolled oats, plus more for topping
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle Guinness
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch baking pan.

Step 2: Mix oats, flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl. Stir butter, vanilla, buttermilk, and Guinness together in a separate large bowl. Pour flour mixture into beer mixture, and gently stir until well combined. Pour batter into the prepared baking pan, and sprinkle with additional oats if desired.

Step 3: Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, then turn the temperature down to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), and bake for an additional 30 minutes. Turn the oven off, open the door, and allow to cool for 30 minutes in the oven before turning out onto a wire rack.

Name: Corned Beef Roast
Ingredients: 1 (5 1/2 pound) corned beef brisket with spice packet
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

Step 2: Place corned beef brisket in the center of a roasting pan. Arrange potatoes and carrots around the sides, then scatter onion and garlic over top. Sprinkle seasoning packet over beef, then pour in water until potatoes are almost covered. Cover with a lid or heavy aluminum foil.
Step 3: Roast in the preheated oven until corned beef is so tender it can be flaked apart with a fork, about 5 to 6 hours.

Name: Bacon-Wrapped Cherries
Ingredients: 36 maraschino cherries, stemmed, drained and juice reserved
Directions: Step 1: Set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
Step 2: Wrap each cherry with a bacon half, secure with a toothpick, and arrange on a baking sheet. Drizzle reserved cherry juice over wrapped cherries.
Step 3: Broil in the preheated oven until bacon is crisped to your liking, 3 to 10 minutes.

Name: Prosciutto-Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with Crispy Sage
Ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 bunch fresh sage, leaves removed and stems discarded, divided
1 tablespoon olive oil, or more as needed
Directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 2: Lightly season pork with salt and black pepper. Arrange about 6 sage leaves over tenderloin. Wrap prosciutto around tenderloin and sage, overlapping prosciutto slightly; wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate to allow prosciutto to set on pork tenderloin, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove plastic wrap.

Step 3: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry wrapped tenderloin in the hot oil until prosciutto is crispy and lightly browned on all sides, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer wrapped tenderloin to a baking dish, reserving oil in the skillet.
Step 4: Bake tenderloin in the preheated oven until pork is cooked through, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
Step 5: Heat reserved oil in the skillet over medium heat; fry remaining sage leaves until crispy, adding more oil as needed, about 5 minutes.
Step 6: Slice tenderloin and serve with crispy sage leaves.

Name: Whoopie Pies
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.
Step 2: Make the cookies: Beat sugar, shortening, and egg yolks together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.

Step 3: Sift flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl; add to shortening mixture in batches, alternating with milk, beating briefly after each addition until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes; transfer to a wire rack and allow to cool completely.
Step 5: Make the filling: Beat confectioners' sugar, shortening, reserved egg whites, and salt together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Stir in vanilla.
Step 6: Choose 2 cookies of the same size; spread a thick layer of filling on the flat side of one cookie; top with remaining cookie. Repeat with remaining cookies and frosting.

Name: Pumpkin Whoopie Pies
Ingredients: 1 ½ cups solid pack pumpkin puree
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease baking sheets.

Step 2: To make the cookie dough: Combine brown sugar and oil in a bowl. Mix in pumpkin and eggs, beating well. Add flour, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and vanilla together into a separate bowl. Fold dry ingredients into wet ingredients and mix to combine.
Step 3: Drop dough by heaping teaspoons onto the prepared baking sheets.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Let cookies cool while you make the filling.

Step 5: To make the whoopie pie filling: Beat egg white in a bowl and mix in milk, vanilla, then 1 cup confectioners' sugar. Mix well then beat in shortening and remaining 1 cup confectioners' sugar. Beat until light and fluffy.

Step 6: Assemble once cookies are cool. Make sandwiches from two cookies filled with whoopie pie filling.
KIM SHUPE

Name: Cake Mix Whoopie Pies
Ingredients: 1 (18.25 ounce) package devil's food cake mix
Directions: Step 1: To make the cakes: Prepare mix as directed on package except using only 3/4 cup of water. Drop batter onto greased cookie sheet (or use parchment paper to line pan) in 2 1/2 to 3 inch circles. Bake until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool.
Step 2: To make the filling: In a saucepan, combine milk and flour and cook, stirring constantly until it forms a thick paste. Let cool.
Step 3: In a medium bowl, beat sugar and shortening until fluffy. Add vanilla. Add cooled flour mixture and beat until double in volume.

Step 4: Turn the little cakes over on their backs. Spoon a dollop of filling onto half of the little cakes. Place the other half of the cakes on top of the filling to form sandwiches.
LYNNINMA

Name: Harissa Butternut Squash Soup
Ingredients: 1 butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cubed (about 4 cups)
4 cups chicken broth or vegetable broth
2/3 cup heavy cream, or as needed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss butternut squash, onion, and whole garlic with olive oil. Spread out on the prepared baking sheet.
Step 2: Roast in the preheated oven until tender and slightly caramelized, 25 to 30 minutes.

Step 3: Place cooked vegetables into the jar of a blender. If ingredients are hot, fill blender no more than halfway full, and hold lid down with a potholder. You may have to work in batches. Add broth, harissa paste, cumin, smoked paprika, and brown sugar. Blend until smooth

Step 4: Pour blender contents into a stockpot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and serve with a swirl of heavy cream, if desired.

Name: Kale and Roasted Delicata Squash Salad with Pomegranate Vinaigrette
Ingredients: 1 pinch sea salt, or to taste
1 pinch white pepper, or to taste
4 cups lacinato kale, coarse stems removed, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 green pear, cored and thinly sliced
1 tablespoon crumbled feta or grated cotija cheese (optional)
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) and line a sheet pan with parchment paper.

Step 2: Split delicata squash lengthwise and scoop out seeds and strands. Cut each squash half crosswise into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place squash pieces in a bowl and toss with olive oil, salt, black pepper, and ginger. Arrange on the prepared pan in a single layer.
Step 3: Roast squash in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes. Using tongs, turn each piece and continue to roast until squash is tender and lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes more. Set aside to cool.

Step 4: For vinaigrette, add pomegranate juice, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, salt, white pepper, and cayenne to a jar with a tight-fitting lid. Cover and shake until well blended, about 30 seconds.

Step 5: For salad, place kale, pear slices, pomegranate arils, and red onion in a large salad bowl. Cut delicata into bite-sized pieces; add to the bowl. Shake vinaigrette again, then toss with salad.

Step 6: Arrange salad on 4 plates, and top with sliced almonds and crumbled bacon; garnish with cheese. Serve immediately.
From the Editor
Here's how to cook bacon in the microwave. For a small amount, this may be the easiest method.

Name: Ultimate Pumpkin Custard Pie
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) and set a rack in the center.

Step 2: Lightly flour a work surface, and roll pastry to a 14-inch round. Press dough evenly into the bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie pan. Trim any excess dough and flute the edges. Freeze pie shell for 15 minutes or refrigerate for 30 minutes before baking,
Step 3: Poke bottom and sides of pie shell with the tines of a fork; line with parchment paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans.

Step 4: Bake crust in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Carefully remove weights and parchment and return the shell to the oven. Continue baking until golden and firm to the touch, about 5 more minutes. Set aside to cool while preparing filling.

Step 5: Add eggs, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, allspice, cardamom, and salt to a large bowl; whisk until well combined. Whisk in whipping cream, sour cream, vanilla bean paste, sugar, bourbon and pumpkin purée until well combined. Pour mixture into pie shell.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes. Transfer the pie to a rack to cool completely.

Name: Air Fryer Baked Yams
Directions: Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Step 2: Scrub yam clean and dry with a paper towel. Rub all over with olive oil.

Step 3: Place yam in the preheated air fryer, and cook until tender when pierced with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes.
Cook’s Note
All air fryers cook differently. This recipe was developed using a Cuisinart Air Fryer Oven, which tends to run hot.

Name: Candied Yams
Ingredients: ¼ cup butter, cut into pieces
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Place drained sweet potatoes in a medium baking dish. Distribute butter pieces evenly over the sweet potatoes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Sprinkle with brown sugar. Layer with miniature marshmallows.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until sweet potatoes are tender and marshmallows have melted, about 20 to 25 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Enjoy!
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Ube Cheesecake
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly spray a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray. Wrap outside of the pan in a double layer of heavy-duty aluminum foil, making sure to reach all the way up the sides of the pan.

Step 2: Prepare the Crust: Stir together graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, granulated sugar, and salt in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Press mixture onto the bottom of the prepared springform pan.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until set and lightly golden, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool for 20 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 4: Prepare the Filling: Beat cream cheese with a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on medium speed until creamy and smooth, about 2 minutes. Add sugar and beat until combined, then add ube jam and cream, beating just until no streaks remain, stopping to scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating on low just until combined after each addition. Add ube extract, vanilla extract, and salt and beat on low until just combined. Pour filling into the cooled crust.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 5: Place springform pan in a large roasting pan. Add hot water to roasting pan to reach halfway up sides of springform pan.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 6: Return to the preheated oven and bake until the center is almost set but still slightly wobbly, 55 to 60 minutes. Turn off oven, and let cheesecake stand in oven, with door ajar (about 3 inches), for 1 hour.

Step 7: Remove cheesecake from roasting pan, and place on a wire rack. Remove foil from outside of the pan, and cool cheesecake to room temperature, about 1 hour. Cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to chill completely, at least 8 or up to 24 hours.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 8: Prepare Ganache: Place chocolate chips in a medium heat-proof bowl. Heat cream in a small saucepan over medium until steaming, then pour over the chocolate. Let stand for 1 minute, then whisk until chocolate is melted and smooth. Add ube extract and whisk to combine. Set aside to cool until thickened, about 15 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 9: Run a knife around outer edge of cheesecake to loosen from sides of pan. Remove sides of pan. Transfer cheesecake to a serving plate or platter. Pour ganache over the top of the cheesecake, letting it drip off the sides. Transfer to the refrigerator and chill until set, about 20 minutes.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Name: Resurrection Rolls
Ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
Step 2: Separate crescent rolls into individual triangles.
Step 3: Mix sugar and cinnamon together in a small bowl.

Step 4: Dip a marshmallow into melted butter, then roll in sugar mixture. Place marshmallow into the center of a dough triangle; carefully wrap dough around marshmallow. Pinch the seams together tightly to seal in marshmallow as it melts. Place roll on a baking sheet; repeat with remaining dough and marshmallows.
Step 5: Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

Name: Pizza Focaccia
Ingredients: 1 (0.25 ounce) packet active-dry yeast (I prefer Red Star®)
Directions: Step 1: For the focaccia: Pour water into a large bowl and sprinkle yeast and sugar on top. Mix briefly with a dough whisk or wooden spoon, then let sit until the yeast has bloomed, about 10 minutes. When ready, the top of the bowl should look like a foamy beer.
Step 2: Stir in olive oil and salt. Add all-purpose flour and bread flour and stir with the dough whisk or a wooden spoon until no dry streaks of flour remain.

Step 3: Cover the bowl and allow to rise for 45 minutes. After 45 minutes, uncover the bowl and wet your hands slightly. Starting at the top of the bowl, use your wet hands to pull the top edge of the dough up and over the dough ball. Continue this process until you work your way all around the dough. This is known as a stretch and fold. It helps to develop gluten and replaces traditional kneading. Cover the bowl again and let sit in a warm spot.

Step 4: After 30 minutes, repeat the stretch and fold process. Cover the bowl and perform two more sets of stretches and folds 30 minutes apart. After the 4th stretch and fold, cover the bowl and let rise for 30 minutes.
Step 5: At this point, the dough should have doubled in volume and should be smooth to the touch. The dough is now ready to be used, or can be chilled overnight to use the next day.

Step 6: For the toppings: Lightly oil a 9x13-inch metal cake pan. Set the focaccia base in the pan, using your fingers to gently stretch it into all four corners. Cover the focaccia and let rise for about 1 hour.
Step 7: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Step 8: After focaccia is risen, lightly drizzle the surface with olive oil. Use your fingers to dimple the surface, then scatter mozzarella cheese in an even layer.
Step 9: Use a spoon to dollop the surface with marinara, then sprinkle the top with Parmesan cheese. Top with pepperoni.
Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until focaccia and cheeses are golden brown and bubbly, 25 to 30 minutes.
Step 11: Remove from the oven and let sit in the pan for about 10 minutes, then carefully slide focaccia onto a cutting board. Let cool for an additional 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Name: Loaded Potato Focaccia
Ingredients: 1 (0.25 ounce) packet active-dry yeast, such as Red Star®
1 Yukon gold potato, thinly sliced on a mandoline
freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Directions: Step 1: For the focaccia: Pour water into a large bowl and sprinkle yeast and sugar on top. Mix briefly with a dough whisk or wooden spoon, then let sit until the yeast has bloomed, about 10 minutes. When ready, the top of the bowl should look like a foamy beer.
Step 2: Stir in olive oil and salt. Add all-purpose flour and bread flour and stir with the dough whisk or a wooden spoon until no dry streaks of flour remain.

Step 3: Cover the bowl and allow to rise for 45 minutes. After 45 minutes, uncover the bowl and wet your hands slightly. Starting at the top of the bowl, use your wet hands to pull the top edge of the dough up and over the dough ball. Continue this process until you work your way all around the dough. This is known as a stretch and fold. It helps to develop gluten and replaces traditional kneading. Cover the bowl again and let sit in a warm spot.

Step 4: After 30 minutes, repeat the stretch and fold process. Cover the bowl and perform two more sets of stretches and folds 30 minutes apart. After the 4th stretch and fold, cover the bowl and let sit for 30 minutes.
Step 5: At this point, the dough should have doubled in volume and should be smooth to the touch. The dough is now ready to be used, or can be chilled overnight to use the next day.

Step 6: For the toppings: Lightly oil a 9x13-inch metal cake pan. Set the focaccia base in the pan, using your fingers to gently stretch it into all four corners. Cover the focaccia and let rise for about 1 hour.
Step 7: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Step 8: Once focaccia has risen for an hour, drizzle the surface with olive oil. Use your fingers to dimple the surface, then scatter cheese in an even layer. Dimple the surface again, then layer the potato slices on top. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon.
Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until the focaccia and cheese are golden brown and bubbly, 25 to 30 minutes.

Step 10: Remove from the oven and let sit in the pan for about 10 minutes, then carefully slide focaccia onto a cutting board. Let cool for an additional 10 minutes, then sprinkle sliced scallions all over before slicing and serving.

Name: Boursin Chicken Baked Ziti
Ingredients: 1/2 cup freshly grated pecorino Romano cheese
1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste
1 (5.2 ounce) package  soft French cheese, such as Boursin® Garlic and Fine Herbs Cheese
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and grease an 8x8-inch baking dish.
Step 2: Combine grated pecorino and breadcrumbs in a small bowl; set aside.
Step 3: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add ziti, and cook until tender with a bite, about 11 minutes. Drain; reserve about 2 tablespoons pasta water.

Step 4: Meanwhile, melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion; cook and stir until onion begins to soften, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in garlic, herb seasoning, and red pepper flakes, and cook about 30 seconds.
Step 5: Turn off heat. Stir in chicken, spinach, cream, Boursin, and mozzarella, stirring until cheeses are melted and ingredients are well combined.

Step 6: Stir drained ziti into chicken mixture. Loosen the sauce with reserved pasta water, if needed. Pour chicken and sauce mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle pecorino and bread crumb mixture over the top.
Step 7: Bake in the center of the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, 20 to 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Name: Best Zucchini Bread
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8x4-inch loaf pans.

Step 2: Beat eggs in a large bowl until light and frothy. Add sugar and oil; mix until well combined. Stir in zucchini and vanilla. Combine flour, nuts, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, and baking powder; stir into egg mixture until incorporated. Divide batter into the prepared pans.
Step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of each loaf comes out clean, 60 to 70 minutes.

Name: Snickerdoodle Zucchini Bread
Directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Spray a loaf pan with non-stick cooking spray. Set aside.

Step 2: Combine 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar, oil, egg, and vanilla in a large bowl; mix well. In another bowl, mix flour, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, baking powder, nutmeg, and cream of tartar. Add flour mixture to oil mixture. Stir until well combined. Batter will be very thick. Add zucchini and stir until well incorporated.

Step 3: Whisk 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl. Pour half the batter into the prepared pan, smoothing with a spatula and top with half of the cinnamon sugar. Top with remaining batter, smoothing with a spatula, and top with remaining cinnamon sugar.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 45 to 55 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes before turning out.

Name: Mom's Zucchini Bread
Directions:
Step 1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8x4-inch pans.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Step 2: Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon together in a large bowl.

Step 3: Beat eggs, oil, sugar, and vanilla together in a separate large bowl with an electric mixer until combined; add flour mixture and beat well.

Step 4: Stir in zucchini and walnuts until well combined.

Step 5: Pour batter into the prepared pans.
